texts.es: Juana nació en la ciudad de Puno pero ahora vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo, a la venta productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar y fideos y tambien a la venta de verduras, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos y esta implementada con la necesidades básicas, ella a tiende a sus vecinos y amigos con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y abarrotes para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Juana  was born in the city of Puno, but she now lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, she is 40 years old, married and has four children that she gets ahead, she works selling chicken meat and first necessity products such as rice, sugar, pasta, as well as vegetables, she has a sale stand in one of the markets of the city of Paucartambo where she offers her products, the sales stand is set up with basic services, she sells to her neighbors and friends with kindness and politeness, reason why they always come back to buy.  It has been several years that she works in this business  and she does well thanks to the effort she puts in her work.  She belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Carmen" and at this time she needs the loan to buy vegetables and groceries to increase capital in the business.  She is thankful and values the loan and commits to meet the monthly payments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groceries

loans.name: Oliener Eduardo

texts.es: Oliener, es un joven soltero de 24 años de edad, no tiene hijos, trabajador, actualmente habita en casa de su abuelita a quien le ayuda económicamente. El trabaja como promotor de crédito en una empresa privada. Actualmente estudia la carrera de Técnico en Administración de Empresas, requiere comprar una computadora para realizar sus investigaciones y no andar prestando dicho equipo, por lo antes expuesto solicita apoyo de crédito para así logar comprar esta herramienta tan importante para su desarrollo profesional y lograr su meta, culminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Oliener is a 24-year-old single man; he has no children.  He’s hardworking and currently lives in his grandmother’s house and helps her out economically.  He works as a credit agent for a private firm and at the same time is studying the technical career of Business Administration Technician.  He needs to buy a computer to do his research and not having to borrow said equipment.  Because of this, he’s asking for a loan to buy this very important tool for his professional development and to reach his goal which is to complete his studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 39-year-old, married father of two children. To make his living, he works in vehicle repairs, specializing in body work. His wife doesn’t work and his children are enrolled in a private school, which forces him to put so much effort to develop his business, to make sure that it will develop to cover his family’s increasing requirements.

Nahed is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to perform necessary maintenance on his house. He can’t afford to pay for this external need from his business since his income barely covers his family’s required needs, and not more. He has to fix the ceiling from the winter’s leakage, to keep his house a healthy living environment for his beloved family.

This is Nahed's fifth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development borrower. He has a good-standing history of paying back his loans. His previous loans helped him a lot in developing his business and in covering his family’s needs. They made a positive push forward, according to his socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Kankélé Group

texts.fr:
Kankélé est un regroupement de femmes de Darsalam I de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habits, de condiments, de la restauration,  des articles  divers,  etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe. 
Fanta  est un membre du groupe Kankélé arrêté en première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des colis d’habits. Elle se procure de ses habits  au grand marché. Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kankélé comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de 175 500CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fanta compte réaliser  195.000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kankélé is a group of women from Darsalam I, in Koutiala, who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other family members. On average, they are 41 years old and have five children. 

They conduct various activities such as the sale clothing, condiments, other items, and also restaurant services. 

They partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to expand their activities. This is their 10th group loan cycle. 

Fanta is seen in the photo standing first from the right. She plans to use her loan to buy clothing. She buys her merchandise at the Grand market and sells at retail for cash to a diverse customer base, from her home and at the market.

The other group members expect to earn an average profit of 175,500CFA each for this cycle, whereas Fanta expects her own profit to reach 195,000FCFA. In addition to loan repayment, the group members will use part of their revenue to cover personal expenses and to bolster their working capital.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores uno de ellos es Mario de 42 años de edad, casado, con cuatro hijos a su cargo de 22, 19, 15, y 12 años. Su negocio es comprador y vendedor de granos básicos. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 4 años. El crédito lo invertirá en compra por quintal de frijoles, maíz, trigo. Alexander tiene 26 años de edad su negocio es venta de granos básicos, María tiene 42 años de edad y su negocio es venta de frutas y Lesbia mujer de 42 años de edad y su negocio es venta de frutas y comida
texts.en: This group is made up of 3 entrepreneurial associates. One of the members is Mario, 42, who is married and has 4 children under his care, ages 22, 19, 15 and 12. His business is buying and selling basic grains. He's been with the institution for 4 years. He'll invest the loan in buying 100 kg of beans, corn and wheat. Other members are Alexander, 26, whose business is selling basic grains; Maria, 42, whose business is selling fruit; and Lesbia, 42, whose business is selling fruit and food.

loans.use: invest in buying 100 kg of beans, corn and wheat.

loans.name: El Faisán Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Lourde de 37 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Su negocio es la venta de perecederos desde hace 20 años. Sus productos los comercializa en el mercado. Tiene 8 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en sacos de cebolla, papa, zanahoria, chiltoma, tomate, etc. Rosa tiene 38 años de edad y su negocio es venta de perecederos y Jessi tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es venta de perecederos.
texts.en: This group consists of three members.  One of them is Lourdes, 37.  She’s single and has a minor son.  Her business for the last 20 years has been selling perishables in the market.  She’s been a client of the institution for 8 years.  She requests the loan to buy sacks of onions, potatoes, carrots, peppers, tomatoes, etc.  Rosa, 38, sells perishables and Jessi, 31, sells perishables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mayling Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxitos uno de  ellos es Juana de 45 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 años ambulantes en las calles de Masaya, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 4 años consecutivos y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras como chayotes, pipián, papaya, melón, piña, naranjas etc. Luis hombre de 55 años de edad su negocio es la venta de verduras y Carlos tiene 22 años y su negocio es la venta de perecederos
texts.en: This group consists of three successful entrepreneurs.  One of them is Juana, 45.  She’s married and her business for the last 15 years has been selling fruit and vegetables from place to place along Masaya’s streets.  She’s been a client of the institution for 4 years and will use the loan to buy vegetables like chayote, pumpkin, melon, pineapple, oranges, etc.  Luis, 55, sells vegetables and Carlos, 22, sells perishables.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Camino Del Desierto Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Ligia mujer de 34 años, soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon y un cafetín en su domicilio desde hace 10 años. Tiene de ser clientes con la institución 4 años lo que refleja que es una buena cliente responsables en sus pagos, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como  perfumen de varón, perfumen de dama, loción de varón, cremas faciales, cremas para manos, cremas para cuerpos, cremas para pies, champo, delineadores, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, etc. Brenda mujer de 29 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos y Verónica tiene 29 años y su negocio es la venta y compra de zapatos también.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members.  One of them is Ligia, 34.   She’s single with a minor son.  Her business for the last 10 years has been selling Avon products and also has a snack bar at home.  

She’s been a client of the institution for 4 years which shows that she’s a good client who is responsible with her payments.  She will use this loan to buy cosmetics like men’s perfume, women’s perfume, men’s lotion, face cream, hand cream, body cream, foot cream, shampoo, eyeliner, nail polish, lipstick, etc.  Brenda, 29, sells shoes and Verónica, 29, buys and sells shoes too.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Octavio Eduardo

texts.es: Octavio tiene treinta (30) años de edad, vive en la hermosa ciudad de Barranquilla, apodada “Curramba la Bella”, con su conyugue y tres (3) hijos, asi, un niño de un (1) año, y dos (2) hijas de cinco (5) y siete (7) años respectivamente. Su negocio consiste en la comercialización de helados de diferentes sabores y frutas, através de conos, que transporta en un triciclo, ofreciendo y vendiendo por las calles y colegios de varios barrios circunvecinos, en horas de la mañana y tarde. Estos productos los vende de contado, y los compra también de contado en una fabrica de helados; sus principales clientes son los niños que apetecen mucho estos productos. Cuenta que hace 12 años llegó a la ciudad y empezó a trabajar cargando bultos en una central de abastos de viveres y abarrotes para tiendas; estando en esa labor se dió cuenta por un vecino que el negocio de los helados era rentable, por lo que se decidió a emprenderlo. Desde el año 2007 inició el negocio, es decir, desde hace seis(6) años. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de helados en cono, cremas de helados, y conos. Tiene las siguientes aspiraciones y metas: 1. En cuanto al negocio, tener 2 triciclos más , para ponerlos a trabajar con otras personas. 2. Adquirir casa propia para su familia.
texts.en:
Octavio, 30, lives in the beautiful city of Barranquilla nicknamed “Curramba la Bella” with his spouse and three children, a one-year-old boy and two daughters who are 5 and 7 years of age respectively.  

His business consists in selling ice-cream cones in various flavors and fruit.  He transports them with a three-wheel cart selling in the streets and at various schools in the surrounding neighborhoods morning and afternoon.  He sells these products for cash and he also buys them for cash from a local ice-cream factory.  His main customers are children who very much enjoy these products.  

He relates that he came to the city 12 years ago and started working carrying bundles in the local wholesale food and grocery market for stores.  While doing that work a neighbor pointed out that the ice-cream business was profitable so he decided to go into it.  He started the business in 2007, that is six years ago.  

This is his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy ice-cream cones and ice-cream.  His goals and hopes are the following:  As to the business, to have two more three-wheeled carts to put them to work with other people and to acquire a house of his own for his family.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream and other frozen treats.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata  est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de  2 enfants. Elle vit avec ses deux enfants dans une famille nucléaire à ATTbougou, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Aminata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente d’habillements et bijoux : des pagnes wax des Tissus brodés, des bazins riches, des colliers en chaines et des boucles d’oreilles.) depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre de façon ambulantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’une année. Elle est à son troisième prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement rembourser.
Ce troisième prêt individuel lui permettra d’acheter 15 pièces de pagne wax,  20 paquets de colliers en chaine, 10 paquets de boucle d’oreilles et 10 complets de bazins riches .
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Madame Aminata  is 42, married and the mother of two children. She lives with her two children in a nuclear family at Attbougou, one of the populous neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republique of Mali. 

Madame Aminata tried a lot of activities without success, then began this income-generating activity, selling clothing and jewelry ("wax" African print cloth, embroidered cloth, "rich" damask, necklaces and earrings) more than five years ago. 

She buys her merchandise in Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso) before hawking it on foot to a clientele composed essentially of women. She is much in demand among her customers because of the good quality of her products. In order to satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than a year ago.

She is on her third individual loan, with all her preceding loans appropriately reimbursed. This third individual loan will allow her to buy 15 lengths of African print cloth, 20 packets of necklaces (chains) 10 packets of earrings, and 10 outfits of "rich" damask. With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be utilized to grow her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy various articles

loans.name: Nelcy Esther

texts.es: Nelcy tiene treinta y nueve (39) años de edad, vive con su conyugue, y tres (3) hijos, un niño de once (11) años, y dos jovencitas de quince (15) y diecinueve (19) años respectivamente. Reside en la ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico, ciudad conocida nacionalmente como la “Arenosa o Curramba la Bella”. Su actividad comercial es la venta de yogures, coolecheritas, helados, bolis y postres. Estos productos alimenticios los vende todos los días, desde su casa, para ello cuenta con una nevera, para conservarlos bien refrigerados. La venta es de contado, sus clientes son los vecinos del barrio donde vive. Compra los productos de marca (Yogures, coolecheritas y helados), de contado, y directamente en las fabricas. Los bolis y los postres, los hace ella directamente. Desde hace tres (3) años inició este negocio, vendiendo inicialmente solo helados, luego aprendió a elaborar los postres, que hoy adicionalmente vende. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de yogures, coolecheritas, y helados en mayor variedad; esto con el objetivo de aumentar las ventas, y hacer crecer el negocio, para sacar adelante a sus hijos, principalmente en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nelcy, 39, lives with her spouse and three children, an 11-year-old boy and two young women who are 15 and 19 years old respectively.  She lives in the city of Barranquilla, Atlántico Department, a city known as “La Arenosa” or “Curramba la Bella.”  

Her commercial activity is selling yogurt, Coolechera brand dairy products, ice-cream, ‘bolis’ [frozen treats in plastic tubes] and desserts.  She sells these food items every day from home and to do so has a refrigerator to keep them well-refrigerated.  Her sales are cash and her customers are local neighbors where she lives.  She buys the brand products (yogurt, ‘coolecheritas’ and ice-cream) for cash directly from the factories.  The ‘bolis’ and desserts she makes herself.  She started the business three years ago initially just selling ice-cream.  Later on she learned how to make the desserts which she sells now too.  

This is her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy yogurt, ‘coolecheritas’ and ice-cream in larger amounts aiming at increasing sales and make the business grow to move her children forward especially with regard to their schooling.

loans.use: to buy yogurt and other frozen treats.

loans.name: Hernandez Jf Group

texts.es:
El señor Rocael esta casado, cuenta con 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la siembra de papa y maíz, inició este negocio desde niño ayudando a sus padres y hasta la fecha lleva 15 años de experiencia en este negocio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para siembra de maíz y papas, desea en el futuro contar con mas terrneo para poder sembrar sus cosechas. Los demás intregrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de maíz y papas.
texts.en:
Rocael, 32, is married and didn't get the chance to go to school. He has 5 children and 3 of them are going to school. He is a farmer and grows potatoes and corn. He started working as a child, helping his parents and now has 15 years of experience in his business. 

He organized this group in order to solicit a loan. He'll use the loan to buy supplies to sow corn and potatoes. He'd like to have more land in the future in order to grow his crops. The other members of the group are also potato and corn farmers.

loans.use: buy supplies to sow corn and potatoes.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is married and has children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, Bintihamisi has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, Bintihamisi wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 42-year-old married man, father of three children. He works in repairing cars and bodywork since twenty five years ago. 
Bilal is a hard worker with a very good reputation in his region. His long experience in his domain earned him customers' trust and support.
Bilal is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua, to buy used cars in order to maintain and sell, which is an additional business with good income that he is developing.
Bilal’s responsibilities are increasing. That’s why he is putting so much effort into developing his business to provide for his family's needs. 
He hopes that in the future he will be capable of buying a special car paint oven, which makes painting cars easier and more professional by decreasing time and increasing quality produced.

loans.use: to buy used cars in order to maintain and sell

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: Celina tiene 52 años, es viuda y vive en su casa propia donde sus hijos independientes le visitan. Celina se dedica a la venta de hojas secas de una palmera amazónica, estas hojas son usadas para el techado de las casas, sus clientes la visitan buscando estas hojas que tienen gran demanda y la buena atención que les brinda. Se inició hace más de 02 años y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y una persona que paga por semana. Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar y aumentar su inversión en el negocio. Esto será el séptimo préstamo con Kiva. Por tanto cuenta  con  su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Con el monto de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la extracción de las hojas y lograr sacar la mayor cantidad posible de hojas, para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Celina, 52, is a widow living in her own house where her independent children visit her.  Celina works selling dried leaves of an Amazonian palm that are used as roofing on houses.  Her customers visit her seeking these leaves which are in great demand and because of the great service she provides.

She started more than two years ago and to date gets help from her children and from a person she pays weekly.  Therefore, seeing the good results, she plans to continue and enlarge her investment in the business.  To do so, this is her 7th Kiva loan and she’s hoping for your collaboration so she can continue towards her objectives.  

On the other hand, she commits once again to make her installment payments like she did with the previous loans she got.  She will use the entire 500 new soles to extract the leaves and to get them in the greatest amount possible in order to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy more leaves to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to increase his production and to pay laborers to help him prepare his farm

loans.name: Alexander Adolfo

texts.es: Alexander tiene 29 años de edad, reside en la famosa ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico, tierra de grandes artistas, como Shakiray Sofía Vergara. El vive con su conyugue y un hijo de un (1) año. Su actividad de negocio, es el servicio técnico de reparación de equipos electrónicos, y la venta de repuestos para los mismos, asi, como la venta de electrodomesticos. Desde hace seis (6) años inició su negocio, en un local ubicado en una vía del barrio donde reside, que tiene bastante afluencia y transito de personas y vehículos. Aprendió este oficio, estudiando electrónica y telecomunicaciones en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje SENA, que es una institución técnica del gobierno central. Es bastante reconocido en el sector por su buen servicio. Atiende de lunes a sábados, de ocho (8) a.m. a seis (6) p.m., su venta es de contado. Compra de contado los repuestos en un almacen que le brinda buenos precios. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de repuestos para electrodomésticos, como Flyback, horizontales, cintaflex, reguladores. Sus metas a corto plazo es la de seguir creciendo con su negocio en cuanto surtido y servicios, y a mediano o largo plazo, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Alexander, 29, lives in the famous city of Barranquilla, Atlántico Department, the land of great artists like Shakira and Sofía Vergara.  He lives with his spouse and one-year-old son.  

His business activity is electronics repairs and the sale of electronics spare parts; he also sells home appliances.  He started the business six years ago in a locale located on one of the streets in the neighborhood he lives in that’s quite busy and has much pedestrian and vehicular traffic.  

He learned his occupation studying electronics and telecommunications at SENA, the National Apprenticeship Service, which is a technical institution of the central government.  He’s quite well known in his sector because of his good service.  He works from Monday to Saturday from 8am until 6pm and his sales are cash.  

This is his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he’ll use it to buy spare parts like Flyback, horizontals, Centaflex and regulators for home appliances.  His short-term goal is to continue growing in business with respect to stock and service and in the medium to long run, to own a house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of hair products and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and tools that help in the weeding and growing of his anthuriums and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of raw food ingredients.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Né en Avril 1967 à Niono, Monsieur Lamine  est un  polygame résidant avec ses épouses et leurs 6 enfants à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas la chance d’avancer aux études, Monsieur Lamine s’est initié il y’a quatre  ans à cette activité d’achat-vente des fruits et légumes (Pomme de terre, orange, lémon, patate, etc.). Nanti d’une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes au niveau de Bamako, Kayes, et Mopti, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il intégre Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour en fin répondre aux attentes de ses clients. Ainsi ce premier crédit au niveau de l’institution qui lui permettra d’acheter dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso 20 sacs de pomme de terre, 10 sacs d’orange, 15 sacs de citron et 20 sacs de patate. Ses ventes sont faites en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales.  
Avec ce premier crédit, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in April 1967 in Niono, Monsieur Lamine  is a polygamous resident of Hamdallaye, living with his spouses and their six children in this working-class neighborhood of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) 

Not having had the good fortune to get on with his studies, Monsieur Lamine began four years ago to buy and sell fruit and vegetables (potatoes, oranges, lemons, yams, etc.) Endowed with such experience in this field, he has an excellent reputation and receives a lot of orders from Bamako, Kayes, and Mopti, but the means to satisfy these needs are lacking. Thus, he joined Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first loan which will permit him to grow his working capital and finally be able to cater for the needs of these customers. 

This first loan with the institution will allow him to buy, in the localities surrounding Sikasso, 20 sacks of potatoes, 10 sacks of oranges, 15 sacks of lemons, and 20 sacks of yams. His sales will be made wholesale and retail, to a clientele composed of all sorts of people. With this first loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000 F CFA which he will use to pay the interest on his loan, investing the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora María  de 51  años, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05  años a la venta de productos alimenticios.
Doña María sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, es una señora muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando.
Doña María  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pollo, espaguetis, salsas, salsas, pastas, café, etc. su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde es visitada por toda su clientela que son vecinos y amigos de su comunidad.
Doña María espera que con la inversión que realice a su negocio le ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia,  su sueño ampliar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013.
texts.en:
María, 51, lives in her house located in the San Lorenzo neighborhood, in the southern part of Honduras. She's been running her grocery store business for 5 years. María's business is open Monday to Sunday. She is a very entreprising woman with much desire to keep working. María is soliciting a loan to buy rice, beans, butter, eggs, chicken, spaghetti, sauces, pastas, coffee, etc. She runs her business from her home, so her clientele is made up of neighbors and friends from her community. María hopes that this loan, which she'll invest in her business, helps improve her quality of life and that of her family. Her dream is to expand her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, butter, eggs, chicken, spaghetti, sauces, pastas, coffee, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current stock of cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of clothes

loans.name: Peliks

texts.en:
Peliks is 52 years old, a married man from the Senaki district of West Georgia. He lives with his wife and three children who go to the local school. The only income source for the family is their small monthly social assistance from the local government institutions, as they belong to the subsistence poor category and live in poverty. 

As the existing income is not enough to make ends meet for a five-member family, Peliks decided to start a trading business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Peliks’s credit requests were rejected several times, as he didn’t satisfy their requirements. 

Peliks received this credit in the framework of  a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. The loan of 700 USD will help Peliks to purchase starting inventory of fruit and vegetables. He will transport the products twice a month from the neighboring town and renew the assortment from local distributors as well.  

Peliks thinks that the business will be profitable, as the market where his stall is situated has a great location and is crowded with people. After the business is started, the family will have a stable income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

Peliks is very enthusiastic and is a hard-working person with a great desire to ensure his children get a good education for progressing in life.

loans.use: to start up selling fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Azuberi

texts.en:
Azuberi is a married mother, She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase two bales of clothes  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes  for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of bread and soap for resale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foods like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Las Buenas Vecinas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatros socios empresarios una de ellas es Rosa mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera con dos hijos y su negocio es de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 8 años quienes les vende sus productos en su comunidad, su hijo mayor le ayuda a atender a los clientes en el negocio, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollos, perecederos, productos lácteos, sal, jabón de baño. Jabón de lavar ropa, jabón de lavar trastos, ase, cloro, desinfectantes, ambientadores etc. Daniela es otro socia y su negocio es de un cafetín y tiene 35 años, Anita tiene 60 años de edad y su negocio es de un cafetín y Guillermo tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de repostería
texts.en: This group is formed by 4 entrepreneurs. One of the members is Rosa, 39, who is single and has 2 children. She's been running a grocery store business in her home for 8 years. She sells products to her community. Her eldest son helps her serve customers. She will invest this loan in rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, perishables, milk products, salt, bath soap, detergent, dishwashing soap, bleach, disinfectants, air fresheners. The other members include Daniela, 35, who runs a small cafe; Anita, 60, who also runs a cafe; and Guillermo, 31, who sells baked goods.

loans.use: invest this loan in rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, perishables, milk products, salt, bath soap, detergent, dishwashing soap, bleach, disinfectants, air fresheners.

loans.name: Sandra's Group

texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old and is a single mother to two children. She was only able to complete three years of senior high school, but she works very hard to support her children by operating a wax-print material sales business. 
She sells her products from door to door, and started her business 10 years ago while helping a mother in a similar endeavor.
Sandra is standing in the middle of photograph.

Sandra's group came together with the common goal of supporting each other's business endeavors and leveraging the opportunities of a loan to grow and strengthen their respective businesses. In view of this agenda they resorted to ID-Ghana for loan and they are in their 4th cycle.

Sandra plans to use the support from this loan to purchase wax-print and material to sell to customers. The other group members make a living selling the same products.

They need a total amount of GHS 3100 to continue competitive businesses with other sellers of the same products.

loans.use: To purchase wax-print and material to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Née en  Octobre à Bamako, Madame Maïmouna est mariée et mère de 3 enfants et réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, Maïmouna s’est initiée depuis plus de cinq années à cette activité de petit commerce notamment à l’achat et vente d’habillements, de pagnes wax,  de sacs à main, des  tissus brodé, etc. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre de façon ambulante de leur localité où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des des femmes de ménages) pour la qualité.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’une année, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
 Ainsi, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 30 pièces de pagne wax, 25 complets de tissus brodé et 30 sacs à main.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Born in Bamako, Madame Maïmouna is the married mother of three children and lives with her spouse and their children in a nuclear family in  Wayerma I, one of the outlying neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) 

After attempting several activities without success, Maïmouna began more than five years ago a small business buying and selling clothing, African "wax" prints, handbags, embroidered cloth, etc. She buys her merchandise in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) before reselling it on foot in their area, where her goods are much in demand among her customers (composed essentially of housewives) because of their good quality. 

Wishing to better satisfy the needs of her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than a year ago. Her preceding loan was correctly reimbursed. Thus she is requesting a second loan to grow her working capital so as to purchase 30 lengths of "wax" African print cloth, 25 outfits of embroidered cloth, and 30 handbags. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA with this loan. The profit will essentially be used to grow her working capital, contribute to covering family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing and handbags for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Andre Marie

texts.fr: André est un jeune camerounais de 21 ans. célibataire, il possède une alimentation dans un quartier de la ville depuis 02 ans.jeune camerounais dynamique , André ne dispose pas un stock assez consistant pour satisfaire sa client sans cesse grandissante et il voudrait avec le crédit acheter: les sacs de riz, les pattes alimentaires, les cartons de sardines et huiles bref les produits de première nécessite en demi gros. les bénéfices tirés de l'activité seront réinjectés dans l'activité et permettront également à André de soutenir financièrement sa famille.
texts.en:
André, aged 21, is a young man from Cameroon.  He is single and, for the past two years, he has been running a small grocery store in one of the neighborhoods of his city.  

He is a young dynamic man, but his stock of merchandise is not large enough to meet the needs of an increasingly large group of customers. 

He would like to use his loan to buy staple foods in semi-bulk quantities: bags of rice, pasta, boxes of sardines and oil. 

The profits from his business will be reinvested in his activity and will also allow him to financially support his family.

loans.use: to buy staple foods such as rice, pasta, sardines and oil.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is a 40-year-old single woman. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi. She works as a saleslady at a local grocery shop. Unfortunately, her existing salary is not enough to cover every-day costs. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So she decided to start a business trading used clothing with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from borrowers. Maia’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. She has received credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the “Startup Program,” which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $1500, she will purchase used clothing and renovate a space where she is going to open a used clothing shop. She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children. It is obvious that the job is hard for Maia, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and gradually develop her trading business. The Start Up credit will be a great support for her, as her income will be significantly increased because of Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to begin trading in used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more frozen chicken for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. For two years, he has been selling phones and, with the profits, he has been able to buy land. He also earns extra income from his monthly salary as a civil servant. High taxes and rent are his major challenges, while his dream is to expand his business to new areas. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy phones to sell.

loans.use: to buy phones to sell.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam would like to take out a further loan to buy rice and other ingredients for making steamed rolled rice pancakes to sell from her stall. Tam's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice and other ingredients for making steamed rolled rice pancakes to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 25 year old Paul from Bulawayo. He is married to Talent, and the couple have one child. Paul runs a retail business. He sells footwear and various clothing items. The business has been in operation for almost seven years. He says the main challenges he faces are high import duties and expensive premises rental. Paul has applied for a loan of $400 to buy clothes and shoes for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to increase his disposable income, which in turn will lead to improved family welfare. He says it will also allow them to put aside savings for their child's future education. In the future, Paul plans to increase business capacity by opening more outlets around town.

loans.use: to buy shoes, ladies' dresses, jeans, men's shirts, t-shirts, ladies' tops and belts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm fruit, which will help her sell more due to increased inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ranjigul

texts.ru: Ранджигул трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Ранджигул более 2 года работает в Медицинском Колледже. Ранджигул работает библиотекарем. Она честно и качественно выполняет свою работу. Ранджигул уже несколько лет мечтает отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег. Она хочет отремонтировать все комнаты, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Ранджигул запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, песок, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ranjigul is a hard-working and conscientious woman. She is single and lives with her parents. Ranjigul has worked as a librarian at the Medical College for two years and is an honest and reliable worker. For several years she has dreamed of renovating their home but has no money to do so. She wants to remodel all of the rooms because the house is in bad condition. Ranjigul is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, paint, and so forth. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials for house repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of ingredients to make her local biscuits, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Afrah Group

texts.en:
This group, called Afrah Group, is made up of five women from Hadramout, Yemen. They are heads of households and they got together with the idea of helping their families. They applied for a combined loan of YER 180,000. 

Afrah is one of the members. She is 46 years old, the president of the group, and she says that she puts a lot of effort into helping her family. She has a business selling all types of clothes, and thanks to this, she has been able to get ahead and help her family. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan of YER 50,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to stock up with clothes for her business, like pants, shirts, and other garments. She wants to be well-stocked, so that she can offer a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to stock up with clothes for her business, like pants, shirts, and other garments.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes, 45 años de edad, casada, del municipio de Chinandega,  con un hijo cursando sus estudios secundarios que aún está a cargo de ella,  es propietaria de una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, cosméticos, embutidos, pollo, carne y otra variedad de productos, así como mercadería en general como ropa, calzado, chinelas entre otros. María vende sus productos de contado y de crédito, cuenta con clientes fijos y también eventuales, De las utilidades de su negocio se abastece el sustento y las necesidades del hogar y su familia, ella está solicitando un financiamiento, para  capital de trabajo, ya que cada vez sus clientes demandan variedad de productos que ella vende en su negocio. María se encuentra muy agradecida y satisfecha con los inversionistas Kivas, ya que le ayudan a obtener un crédito para invertir mas en el negocio y de esta manera, salir adelante con la familia.
texts.en:
María Lourdes is 45 years old, married and is from the municipality of Chinandega. She is responsible for one son, who is studying at a secondary school. She owns a store where she sells basic grains, sausages, chicken, meat and a variety of other products as well as general merchandise such as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, slippers amongst other things. Maria sells her goods in cash and on credit. She has regular customers as well as walk in trade. She pays for the household and family expenses with the profits from her business.

She is requesting this loan as working capital as her customers want a variety of goods from her store. Maria feels very grateful and happy with Kiva lenders, as they help her get a loan to invest more in her business and thus get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to invest in her grocery store and buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy would like to take a new loan to buy beverages to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can improve both her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Iglecia De Dios Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Verónica su negocio es la venta de verduras  y frutas frescas, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera y con dos hijos mayores. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de papas, cajas de tomates, cebollas, chiltoma, aguacate, granadilla, sandias, melón, naranja dulce, limones, naranja agria etc. María vende comida tiene 58 años de edad y Ramona tiene 30 años y su negocio también es la venta de verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising women. One of them is Veronica and her business is selling  fresh fruit and vegetables. She is 50 years old, single and has two grown children. She'll use this loan to buy sacks of potatoes, cases of tomatoes, onions, peppers, avocados, passion fruit, watermelon, melon, oranges, limes, bitter oranges etc. 

Maria is 58 and sells food. Ramona is 30 and also sells vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, cases of tomatoes, onions, peppers, avocados, passion fruit, watermelon, melon, oranges, limes, bitter oranges etc.

loans.name: Bibihilol

texts.ru: Бибихилол живет в сельской местности. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант. Он подрабатывает разнорабочим. Бибихол является основной кормилицей в семье. Она более 3 года занимается скотоводством. Бибихол так как живет в сельской местности, ей очень удобно развевать бизнес скотоводством. Она имеет большой огород, где она выращивает сено для скота. Она хочет развевать бизнес дальше и получать больше дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2050 долларов США для покупки скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Bibihilol lives in a rural area.  She is 47 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is a migrant worker.  He works as a laborer.  Bibihilol is the main provider for the family.  For more than three years she has worked with livestock.  Because she lives in a rural area, it's very convenient to work with animals.  She has a large garden where she grows hay for her cattle.  She wants to expand her business further to increase her income.  She is asking for a loan of 2050 USD to buy cattle which will increase her working capital.  She awaits your kindness.  This loan will help improve her circumstances.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Jose Oscar

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de más dinero para iniciar el cultivo de maíz, por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo; este le servirá para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que las condiciones económicas han mejorado, aumento la productividad y sus utilidades las invierten en los gastos básicos del hogar, se mantiene el mismo grupo familiar.
texts.en: José is about to start sowing corn and is need of capital to begin, which is why he is requesting a new loan. This loan will serve to buy the agricultural supplies necessary, like manure, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides, among others. The previous loan made a favorable difference, as his economic situation improved and productivity increased. The newly generated income was invested in basic household expenditures and maintaining his family.

loans.use: Para comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.

loans.name: Toshquvat

texts.ru:
Тошкуват проживает в районе Н. Хусрав. Он 45-летний женатый мужчина. У него большая и дружная семья. Тошкуват скромный и очень добрый человек. У него сын, и трое дочерей. Тошкуват занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает овощи на небольшом участке земли у себя при доме. В этой области у него имеется богатый опыт. 
Тошкуват трудолюбивый человек. Он целый день усердно работает на своем орошаемом участке земли, чтобы получить богатый урожай для торговли. Этот вид деятельности является основным источником дохода семьи. Жена Тошкувата занимается домашним хозяйством. Во дворе дома у них имеется коровник. Сейчас у Тошкувата 2 коровы. За скотом присматривает его жена. 
Тошкуват хочет заняться купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он будет совмещать животноводство и растениеводство. В этом ему будет помогать его жена. 
Тошкуват берет кредит для закупа бычка и телят. Он заранее благодарит всех за помощь.
texts.en: Toshquvat lives in Nisiri Khusrav, Tajikistan.  He is 45 years old and married.  He has a big, happy family.  Toshquvat is a modest and very kind person.  He has one son and three daughters.  Agriculture is the profession he's chosen.  He grows vegetables on a small plot of land by his home.  He has much experience in the industry and is very hardworking.  He works hard all day on his farm so that he harvests good crops to sale.  This is the main source of income for the family.  Toshquvat's wife is a homemaker.  In their yard, there is a barn and they currently have two cows that his wife looks after.  Toshkuvat wants to start selling cattle.  He will combine his livestock business with his agricultural activities.  His wife will help him with this.  Toshquvat is taking a loan to buy a bull and calf.  He is grateful in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a bull and a calf to diversify his business

loans.name: Jeimmy Group

texts.es: Este grupo formado por tres socios una de ellas es Rosaura mujer viuda con un hijo de 11 años, a su cargo su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y variada y brindar servicio de taxis este con el apoyo de otro hijo mayor que no está a su cargo. Tiene esta actividad desde hace 10 años consecutivos, este crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de ropa variada y nueva. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 4 años. Edith su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y la venta de ropa nueva y Adolfo tiene 60 años y su negocio es la de una funeraria.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three members, one of which is Rosaura, a widow who takes care of her 11-year-old son. 

Her business is selling new and varied clothes, and also provides a taxi service, the latter of which is done together with an elder son who is independent. She has been doing these businesses for 10 consecutive years. Rosaura wants to use this loan to buy new and varied clothes. She has been a client of this institution for 4 years. 

Edith, sells cosmetics and new clothes, and Adolfo is 60 years old and his business is running a funeral home.

loans.use: to buy new and varied clothes

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим жизнерадостный и чистосердечный человек. Он старается получить максимум позитива от всех ситуаций. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Иброхим научился у пекаря печь лепешки. Он знает все тонкости своего мастерства и является опытным пекарем. Он изготавливает лепешки у себя дома, где имеет национальную печку «тандыр». Он продает свои лепешки на местном рынке и имеет своих клиентов. Он занимается этим бизнесом более 6 лет. Его бизнес является единственным источником дохода, так как его жена домохозяйка. В этом году он купил земельный участок,  накопив деньги в течение нескольких лет. Теперь он хочет начать стройку дома, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, песок и т.п. для стройки дома. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ibrohim is a cheerful and open-hearted person.  He tries to get the most amount of good from every situation.  He is married but doesn't have any children.  Ibrohim studied from a baker how to make flatbread.  He knows all the ins and outs of his profession and is a very experienced baker.  He bakes from his own home where he has the national oven, the tandoor.  He sells his good at a local market where he has his own clients.  This has been his profession for more than six years.  His business is the sole source of income since his wife is a homemaker.  This year he bought a plot of land with money he'd saved for a few years.  Now he wants to start construction on a home but he doesn't have the funds.  He is asking for a loan of 3,000 KGS to buy building materials like cement, wood, sand, etc. to begin.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, and soil to build a house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beverages, salt, sugar, cosmetics and other retail items

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
As a married mother of of eight children, Sebastiana works hard to support her family. She sells dry goods in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store and food vending. Sebastiana is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

Sebastiana has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ahmadbek

texts.ru: Ахмадбек житель города Вахдат. Ему 36 лет. Он женат и живет у родителей. У него пока нет детей. Ахмадбек в течение 3-х лет работает таксистом. Он развозит пассажиров по маршрутной линии город Вахдат - город Душанбе. За день он делает 6 рейсов по этой линии. Ахмадбек хорошо зарабатывает и ежедневные расходы семьи лежат на его плечи. В данный момент Ахмадбеку необходимо отремонтировать свою машину, а также провести ремонт в доме. У него на руках мало денег и поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Ахмадбек на половину суммы кредита хочет устранить технические неполадки своей машины, а остальную часть потратить на ремонт дома, чтобы улучшить условия проживания. Он обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет дохода с деятельности. Сейчас он нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Ahmadbek lives in Vahdat, Tajikistan.  He is 36 years old, married and lives with his parents.  He does not have any children yet.  For three years he has worked as a taxi driver.  He takes passengers between Vahdat and Dushanbe.  He makes the trip six times each day.  Ahmadbek earns a good living and the responsibility of paying for his family's expenses falls on him.  At the moment, he needs to make repairs to both his car and his home.  He has little money currently so he's taking out a loan.  Ahmadbek will use half the loan to make mechanical repairs to his vehicle and the other half on home repairs to improve his living conditions.  He promises to repay the loan on time with the income from his business.  Now he needs your support.

loans.use: to make mechanical repairs to his vehicle as well as repairs to his home in order to improve his living circumstances

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman and has been blessed with three children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 38-year-old married father of three children, living in a village in the Bekaa valley. He drives a small "pick-up" around his village, transporting construction materials, which is how he has been earning his living for the past 20 years. His wife is unemployed, meaning that Ali is the only financial provider of the family. His children are enrolled in a private school, which means that he has to cover the tuition fees on top of all the other family expenses. 

Ali contacted Al Majmoua and decided to acquire a loan because his small truck has not been functioning properly recently. Without his truck, he will not be able to achieve his daily missions, meaning that maintaining his truck is crucial. The loan will financially support him with these costs. As for the future, Ali wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on his truck

loans.name: Peggy

texts.en:
Peggy is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned high cost of seasonality as her major challenge and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.ru: Абдукодир добродушный  мужчина в возрасте 60 лет. Он женат  и имеет пятерых детей. Все его дети уже взрослые и имеют свои семьи. Абдукодир живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Несмотря на свой возраст, он полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. Абдукодир  занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется  земельная площадь, которая  составляет около 12 га. Из общей площади земли  8 га составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли.  На этой земле  Абдукодир занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот.  Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Абдукодир хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Абдукодир заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Abdukodir is a good-natured man, age 60.  He is married and has five children.  All his kids are already grown and they have their own families.  Abdukodir lives with his wife in a small home in a rural village.  Despite his age, he is full of energy and the desire to work to support his family.  He is a farmer and works with livestock.  He has a plot of land which is about 12 hectares.  Of that, about eight hectares are rain fed and the rest is irrigated.  On this land, he grows carrots, potatoes and grains.  His wife helps him care for and raise the animals.  Since they have a lot of land, he also has his cattle graze on it.  Because the livestock business brings in a good income, Abdukodir wants to expand it and increase his herd.  For this, he turned to Arvand for a loan to buy cattle.  Abdukodir is grateful in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 41-year-old single man, living in the suburbs of Beirut. He owns a small garage where he is in charge of fixing spare parts and painting cars. He has been working in this field for the past 19 years. He decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase raw materials and a new work kit. This would enhance his business and thus increase the number of customers, along with his revenue. 

As for the future, Hussein wishes to purchase an oven specialized for the painting of cars, which would greatly facilitate his work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and a new work kit

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Ut would like to take a further loan to buy new computers and accessories for her internet services. Ut's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new computers and accessories for her internet service.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 32-year-old married father of two children. He is of Syrian origin and lives in a small village in the Bekaa valley. He owns a small farm where he breeds sheep, trades them, and sells their milk, which is how he has been earning his living for the past two years. His wife helps him with the farming process. He decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase additional sheep and increase his output. As for the future, Ali hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep and increase his output

loans.name: Harb

texts.en:
Harb is a 36-year-old married father of two children, living in a small village in southern Lebanon. He has been a plumber for the past fifteen years and specializes in water basins. His wife is currently unemployed and his revenue is barely enough to provide for his family.

Both of Harb’s children are enrolled in a private school, which means that he has to pay tuition fees on top of all of his other family expenses. Because of tight money, Harb decided to apply for a 3,000,000 LBP loan through Al Majmoua to cover school fees so that his children will be able to attend school next year.

As for the future, Harb wishes to expand his business and work on large-scale projects.

loans.use: to cover his children's school fees

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh, 58, is widowed and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Hanh started a food stall to sell breakfast meals for her customers one year ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying rice and good quality foods to make meals to sell from her food stall. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice and good quality food to make meals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an increased amount of cassava

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 38-year-old single lady. She owns a small shop where she has sold women clothes and lingerie since 2010, with 18 years of experience in this domain. 

She lives with her family of six members, which means that her shop is an important financial resource for the family. Thus she decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase a summer collection, in order to satisfy the demand of her customers. 

As for the future, Najwa wishes to expand her shop.

loans.use: to purchase a summer collection, in order to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en:
Mayada is a 26-year-old married mother of one child.  She has worked as a hairdresser for two years, and has a very good reputation in her domain.

Mayada is a hard worker and a very talented person in her field, with a good number of loyal customers. Her husband has a low income business, and her family’s needs are increasing, which is why she’s encouraged to acquire a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to start a new business which will provide her family with and additional income.  She will open a shop where she will start selling charcoal that’s highly requested for hookah businesses, and she will ask her husband to manage this business because she finds herself among beautiful ladies and surrounded with beauty all the time.

She also sells lady’s dresses for special events, and hopes that one day she will open a special events dressing shop either separated from her beauty salon or she will move to a wider place where both businesses will have enough space to facilitate customers’ needs.

loans.use: to start a new business which will provide her family with an additional income

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 22-year-old single man from a village called Khaseb near Tulkarem City. Fadi works in a barber shop he owns, and he has been working on it for two years. It is a profitable job. Fadi is very famous in his village, and he has his loyal customers.

Fadi would like to develop his business, so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to make some improvements and new decorations, like buying new chairs and some hair products he uses in his work.

Fadi appears outside his shop.

loans.use: to make some improvements and new decorations, like buying new chairs and some hair products he uses in his barber shop.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 26-year-old married man living in a small Lebanese town. He has worked at selling hookahs and their accessories, such as charcoal, for six years. It is his source of financial support, since his wife is unemployed. In order to be able to settle down and start thinking about having children, Khaled needs to increase his income. 

Thus he decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a YOUTH loan that would support him in purchasing new hookahs and and hookah accessories. As for the future, Khaled wishes to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new hookahs and hookah accessories

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 54 años es una mujer sencilla y luchadora. Cuidó sola de sus 7 hijos y ahora vive solo con una de ellas en una casa alquilada desde hace 4 años. Su trabajo es diverso, a pesar de su avanzada edad  María, tiene la vitalidad de una niña. Trabaja vendiendo comida, dulces y gelatinas por cantidad en todas las festividades de los pueblos cercanos , además teje chompas, gorras, chalinas y demás prendas a base de lana natural y palitos de madera, su creatividad y constancia hacen que obtenga clientes fijos. Ahora tiene muchos tejidos que entregar entre gorras, guantes y chalinas de lana, ya que se acerca la temporada de lluvias. 
Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido ya que esto le permite seguir adelante. María, invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de lana por cantidad de diferentes colores, tamaños y texturas para realizar sus tejidos.
texts.en:
María, 54, is a modest and tenacious woman. She raised her 7 children alone, and now lives with one of them in a house they have rented for the past 4 years. Her work is varied, and despite her advanced age, María has the vitality of a young girl. She sells food, sweets, and jellies in bulk at all of the festivals in nearby towns. As well, she knits sweaters, hats, scarves, and more using natural wool and wooden needles. Her creativity and perseverance have attracted regular clients. Now that the rainy season is approaching, she has a lot of knitting to deliver, including hats, gloves, and woollen scarves. 

This is her second loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support she has already received which has allowed her to move forward. María will invest this 800 soles in the purchase of wool in bulk in different colours, sizes, and textures to complete her knitting.

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk in different colours and sizes.

loans.name: Talita Cumi Group

texts.es: Socias emprendedoras de éxito es el grupo conformado por tres empresarias una de ellas es Lizeth tiene 35 años de edad, casada, dos hijos de 15 y 11 años respectivamente, desde hace 5 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales, repostería, gaseosas, refrescos naturales y helados. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carne de cerdo, hoja de chagüites, sal, arroz,achiotes, naranja agria, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, tocino, compra de repostería, gaseosas etc. Maribel tiene una pulpería y su edad es de 50 años y María de Jesús  vende ropa usada y cosméticos de la Avon y su edad es de 34 años de edad.
texts.en:
The members are successful entrepreneurs. It is a group made up of three businesswomen. One of these is Lizeth who is 35 years old, married, and has two children of 15 and 11 years respectively. 

For 5 years her business has been the sale of nacatamales [a Nicaraguan tamale], pastries, sodas, natural beverages and ice cream. She will invest this loan in the purchase of raw material such as pork, banana leaves, salt, rice, "achiote" [a seed used for seasoning or coloring], bitter orange, tomato, sweet pepper, onion, bacon, and in the purchase of pastries and sodas, etc.
  
Maribel owns a small market and is 50 years old; María de Jesús sells second hand clothing and Avon cosmetics and she is 34 years of age.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as pork, banana leaves, salt, rice, "achiote", bitter orange, tomato, sweet pepper, onion and bacon; as well as to purchase pastries, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is 22 years old from Gaza. She works in embroidery on clothes, bags, purses etc.

She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a sewing machine to help her increase the productivity of her sewing shop in embroidery. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income and thus help her parents whom she lives with improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to help her increase the productivity of her sewing shop in embroidery.

loans.name: Xoa

texts.en:
Xoa is 57 years old and is divorced with one daughter. Xoa has been running a fashion shop for six years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

 Xoa is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more kinds of clothes to sell and satisfy her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Leri

texts.en:
Leri is 40 years old and a married man. He lives in the capital city of Georgia with her wife Lali and infant child. Lali is unemployed; she is looking after their child and stays home. Leri served local people as a taxi driver and generates a small monthly income, which is not enough for a three-member family for covering everyday costs. There is high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. 

Leri also decided to start his own business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he didn’t satisfy their requirements. 

Leri received this credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Start-up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of $4000, he will purchase second-hand cars, which are amortized and not in use and start selling the spare parts. He has already rented a commercial space, where he is going to open his auto spare parts shop and make additional income. This credit will be a great support for the family. Leri is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to increase their income.

loans.use: to begin selling auto spare parts

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en: Etaf was born in 1963. She lives in Amman, Jordan with her husband and two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver, which does not let him earn enough money to cover their needs. Etaf has been working in trading clothes. As she doesn’t have enough money to buy new clothes to be able to trade them. She is asking for a loan to increase the amount of merchandise she has, in addition to increasing the amount of purchases to help her husband in covering her children's needs.

loans.use: to increase the amount of merchandise she carries, including clothes

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 36 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and has three children between the ages of 10 and 18. Her children are in school and live at home. She stopped her education in the 5th grade. She describes herself as a hard working mother. For the past five years she has been operating a shop which sells rubber dishes in the community market. 

She spends 10 hours daily at her business. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Most of the time she use a shared-taxi to get goods to her shop. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase dishes such as plates, bowls, cups, and buckets, etc for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase dishes such as plates, bowls, cups, and buckets, etc for her business,

loans.name: Qasim's Group

texts.en:
Qasim is a member of this group of men from south Iraq. Qasim is 34 years old, and is a married father of three children. He is a butcher and has a meat shop in his city. Qasim has ten years of experience with the business which generates the main income for his family.

To improve the services he can offer to his customers and improve the butchers shop, he would like to buy a small generator and a meat grinder machine. To be able to make this purchase, he took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers 'group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor, and are therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity.
