Her children are between ages 19  and 16. She said that three of her children are in school and they all live at home.

Lucy received a small amount of money from her husband to establish her business seven years ago; she has been running a small local shop where she makes and sells local soap, palm oil etc., she spends 10 hours a day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is low income. She will use the loan to purchase more soap, palm oil, caustic soda, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, palm oil, caustic soda, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a green grocery selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality of products, hence reducing the sales. 

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Kelly se dedica a la venta de comida, también prepare refrescos con frutas naturales, brinda siempre un trato amable, y una buena sazón. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 04 años. Empezó siendo ayudante de su madre quien ahora le dio el control total del negocio. Además de trabajar también esta  estudiando y tiene que darse tiempo para dedicarse a sus estudios. Anteriormente vendía jugos y panes durante las mañanas pero tuvo que cambiar de actividad debido a la importancia que representa para ella forjarse una carrera académica. Le gustaría mucho poder agrandar su negocio y poner más mesas, sillas e implementarlo con algunos utensilios. Esto será su séptimo préstamo con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que le brinda un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de ingredientes como arroz, pollo, aceite, y frutas, además de otros artículos como  sillas y otros utensilios.
texts.en: Kelly is 21 years old, single, lives with her parents, sells food and also makes soft drinks with natural fruits.  She always provides friendly service, good seasoning, and has been working this way for four years, having started out helping her mother who has since given her control of the business.  Aside from working, she also studies and must set aside time.  She used to sell juices and bread in the morning, but she had to change because it was important to her to focus on her studies.  She would very much like to grow her business and set up tables and chairs and some utensils.  This will be her seventh loan through Kiva and she is happy to know that she has financial support so she can continue advancing her business.  She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy ingredients such as rice, chicken, cooking oil, and fruit, along with other items such as chairs and other utensils.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is a 27-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be humble and respectful. 

She operates a beauty salon where she does hairdressing, hair plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are women. 

Charlotte will use the KES 40,000 loan to add stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and other beauty salon items. 

Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will settle down. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and other beauty salon items.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children, ages 3 years and 6 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located near a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough finances to boost her business.

Beatrice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more shoes for resale. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and repay the loan.

loans.use: buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en: Patima is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives in the capital city of Georgia with her husband Avtandil and son George. Avtandil is unemployed. In this region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  Patima works as a tailor from home. She gets orders to sew different types of clothing for men and woman. Her income is not enough for the three-member family, so she decided to start a business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Patima’s credit requests were rejected several times since she didn't satisfy their requirements. She received her loan in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of $3,000, Patima will open a household goods shop. She will rent a commercial space and stock of goods. Avtandil will work with her in the shop. The new business initiative will give the family a chance to have a stable income along with the orders she gets from her customers to sew clothes.

loans.use: to start trading household goods

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus dos hijas en su casa propia. Lourdes se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene sembríos de papa, maíz, habas, trigo, cebada y pastizales, el cual le sirve de alimento para su ganado. Con su familia se ha propuesto mejorar cada año y superar su producción agrícola y ganadera, ya que su secreto es comercializar los alimentos en otra ciudad. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Lourdes, invertirá los S/.1800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en: Lourdes is 46 years old and is a hard-working woman. She lives with her two daughters in their house. Lourdes works in agriculture and cattle-rearing and grows potato, corn, beans, wheat, barley, and pasture which she uses to feed her cattle. She and her family have set themselves the goal of improving every year and increasing their agricultural and cattle production so they can sell the food in other cities. This is Lourdes's fourth loan from Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support she receives from them which allows her to get on in life. She also pledges to make timely repayments. Lourdes will invest 1800 soles to buy organic manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with two children and both her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last four years. She works six days a week. She has no other source of income. She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 200,000 UGX to buy a bale of second hand shoes. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and but does not have access to piped water.  Her goal and aspiration is to build a residential house. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married, and has children. She has owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a brick-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality of products, hence reducing the sales. 

With the KSH 45,000, she wants to purchase more sacks of bricks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of bricks for resale.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: semilla, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y pago de mozos.
El préstamo anterior fue favorable, ya que logro cumplir con lo que necesitaba la cosecha y logro obtener una excelente producción, la familia se ha mantenido. Hoy en día ya cuenta con energía eléctrica propia, asimismo construyo una nueva casa y ha agregado otro tipo de actividad.
texts.en: Hector has decided that it is necessary for him to request a new loan because he needs money to help him buy the agricultural supplies he needs such as seeds, manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and to pay labor costs. The previous loan was of great help to him as it covered the costs of the things he needed for the harvest and he managed to obtain an excellent crop and this allowed him to provide for his family. He now has electricity at home, has built another house, and has found other sources of work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 34 years old. She lives in a rented house with her eight-year-old son, whom she says wants to be a pilot when he grows up. Jean runs her own Zoona money transfer shops in the Kazungula and Kalomo towns of Zambia. Her business enables people to send and receive monies to and from their families and friends throughout the country. She says providing this service to people helps her pay for her rentals and son’s school fees.

Jean started running her Zoona money transfer business six months ago. Business is good and she says the one thing holding her back is that she does not have enough working capital to serve her customers at the desired time. She says this makes her panic sometimes because she constantly has to run up and down trying to find some money.  As a micro-entrepreneur, Jean has found it very difficult to source working capital. She explains that she had gotten a loan from a Micro lending institution but the interest was too high and it almost collapsed her business. Jean is taking out this loan so that she can increase her working capital and grow her business by serving more customers. “This Kiva loan is the only chance I have to grow my business and am grateful for this lifetime opportunity’’ Jean says.

Jean has high hopes for her future. Her face brightens when she explains that her biggest dream is to see her business grow so that she can put her son through college and build her own house from the profits.

loans.use: To increase her working capital to send and receive large amounts of monies

loans.name: Layvah

texts.en:
Layvah lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia.

Layvah is 40 years old. She did not go to school, and she is unmarried. She has a 20-year-old child who lives at home. With a little money from her fiancee, who works with WFP, she managed to establish her business three years ago. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends 10 hours [a day] on her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil for her business. Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernan nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta hermosa ciudad, él tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos a quienes saca adelante, él se dedica a la venta de carne de cordero, res, pollo, vacuno y porcino, él tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos y el puesto de venta esta implementado con la necesidad básicas, él administra su negocio y a tiende a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar al puesto de venta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carne. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Hernan was born in Paucartambo city in Cusco department and lives together with his family in this beautiful city. He is 30 years old and has a long-term partner with whom he has four children who he does his best to provide for. He sells lamb, beef, chicken, and pork from a small stall that he has in one of the markets in Paucartambo. His stall is fitted with everything he needs for his business. He runs his business by himself, serving his relatives, neighbors and friends in a friendly and polite way which makes them keep returning to buy from him. He has been working in this area for several years and his business is successful due to his hard work. He is part of the Mamacha Carmen communal bank and, this time, he requires the loan to buy meat. He is grateful for the loan and is deeply committed to making the monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She does not have additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last six years. She works six days a week. Her other source of income is from selling piped water from home. She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 700,000 UGX to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration are to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity .Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a watch repair shop, where he repairs watches and also sells watches. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan to expand his business by buying more watches to sell and other repair materials. His business goal is to have a self-sustaining business within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more watches to sell and other repair materials

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 26-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a clothes store where she sells dresses and makes dresses. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Jeannette De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Jeannette, se decide  por un nuevo préstamo para adquirir equipo para realizar mejor sus operaciones; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar una maquina industrial y una mesa de 2 x 2 metros, asimismo artículos para la costureria.
 El préstamo anterior le sirvió de manera positiva para el fortalecimiento del negocio y a tener en este tiempo, ya un taller establecido, las condiciones económicas se mantienen estables y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado debido  que tiene una fuente estable de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jeannette decided to apply for a new loan to get equipment to be able to improve her operations. This investment will help her to buy an industrial sewing machine and a table that is 2 meters by 2 meters, as well as sewing items.

The previous loan helped her to strengthen her business and to already have an established workshop. Her economic condition has remained stable and her family circumstances have improved thanks to her having a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and a table that is 2 meters x 2 meters, as well as sewing items.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu was born in 1979 and she has been living in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and the living condition is much better than the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She stopped her education at ninth grade and described herself as businesswoman. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have seven children between 21 and 2 years old.  Only six of her children are in school and live at home. From selling her husband's farm products, she was able to establish her business six years ago by been running a table where she sells dried bush meat. She spends 10 hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried meat for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more dried meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dresses for resale

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
FAUSTO  tiene 49 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y con la esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Fausto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertiliznates, herbicidas, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura.

El sueño es comprar terrenos y un regadío para los cultivos.
texts.en:
Fausto is 49 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children in La Chonta, Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He is a member of La Chonta communal bank. This area is dedicated to agricultural and livestock raising.

Fausto is a farmer, who grows corn and soya. He needs this loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide and manure. With the help of this loan he can buy all that he needs for farming. His dream is to buy land and irrigation for his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and manure.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta is 36 years old. She lives Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She did not go to school and she has lived all her life in a rural area, Traditionally, she is married and her husband is a farmer. They have three children between 16 to 8 years old who are in school and live at home. With a little money from her mother, she was able to establish her business. Since 2006, she has been running a small local shop where she sells artificial hair. She spends nine hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 45 años es una mujer alegre. Tiene 3 hijos, pero solo vive con una de ellas en la casa que compró hace 6 años. Olga se dedica a cultivar papa, maíz y alfalfa el cual le sirve para alimentar a sus animales, ya que tiene vacas y ovejas los cuales son vendidos a los pobladores de su localidad , lo cual le genera más ingresos económicos. Pero como es muy trabajadora, también trabaja embolsando carne de pollo en una empresa de su ciudad, está actividad la realiza dos veces por semana, pues tiene que cuidar de sus animales  y sus porductos agrícolas. Ahora se ha trazado metas concretas para  seguir creciendo. Y está segura de lograrlo.
Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Olga, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Olga is a happy 45-year-old woman. She has 3 children, but she only lives with one of them in a house that she bought 6 years ago. Olga grows potatoes, corn, and alfalfa, which she serves to her animals. She has cows and sheep that she sells to the people in her town. This way, she generates more economic income. But since she is very hardworking, she also works packaging chicken at a business in her city. She does this activity two times a week, since she also has to care for her animals and her agricultural products. Now she has set specific goals to continue growing. And she is sure to achieve them.

This is her fourth loan with KIVA and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue moving forward. She promises to pay her bills on time. Olga will use the 1000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish their crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 64 años de edad, está divorciada y vive en su casa propia junto su hija y sus nietos. Nelly se dedica a la costura y confección de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, contando un pequeño taller que instaló en su casa, Tiene más de 30 años realizando ésta actividad, contando con la ayuda de una señora. Comenta que  aprendió esta actividad estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, y le ha servido como una fuente de ingreso económico y así sentirse una persona productiva. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por eso tiene planes de abrir una boutique en su propia casa, donde pueda exhibir sus productos. Esto será el segundo préstamo  con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a  cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos elásticos y otros.
texts.en: Nelly is 64 years old. She is divorced and lives in her own house with her daughter and her grandchildren. Nelly works sewing and making clothing for women, men, and children. She has a small workshop that she installed in her house. She has been working in this job for more than 30 years with the help of another woman. She says that she learned to sew studying at an occupational education center, and it has been her source of economic income and allowed her to become a productive person.  She considers her business quite profitable because of the good earnings she gets. For this reason, she plans to open a boutique in her own house, where she can display her products.  This will be her second loan with Kiva. She is content to know that she will have financial support, since she will feel secure advancing her business. She promises to complete her payments. With the amount of 1000 soles she will buy sewing materials, such as fabrics, thread, and elastic, among others.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials, such as fabrics, thread, and elastic, among others.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando, a sus 52 años de edad se dedica a la producción agrícola de zanahorias, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre desde hace aproximadamente 25 años, el producto cosechado es vendido en la plaza del pueblo de Sonsón localizado al oriente de Antioquia. El señor Hernando necesita de la compra de abonos, riegos y semillas que le permitan mejorar su cultivo puesto que el invierno le ha desmejorado considerablemente la producción. El señor Hernando espera mejorar sus ingresos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y dos hijos.
texts.en: Hernando, age 52, grows carrots. He learned this work from his father approximately 25 years ago and sells the harvested product in the plaza of the Sonsón village, located in the east of Antioquia. He needs to pay for manure, irrigation, and seeds in order to improve his crops; the winter took a considerable toll on production. Hernando hopes to improve his income and to offer his wife and two children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for manure, irrigation, and seeds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María  de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijos quienes viven en su casa de habitación, ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña María se dedica a la venta de tortillas, refrescos, agua, juegos naturales y sus clientes son sus vecinos de la aldea, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 05 años. 
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para comprar maíz, piña, sandia, melón, nance, refrescos, etc. para hacer los refrescos naturales  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir invirtiendo más en su negocio y seguir creciendo para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Doña María su sueño es ir mejorando su casa de habitación.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
Sra. María is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children in a house located in the community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras.

Doña María sells tortillas, soft drinks, water, and natural juices. Her clients are neighbors from the area. She has been in this business for five years. Doña María is requesting a loan in order to buy corn, pineapple, watermelon, nance fruit, soft drinks, and other items for making natural beverages. With the support of this loan, she intends to continue investing in her business and keep growing so that she can provide a better future for her children.

Doña María dreams of making improvements to her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, pineapple, watermelon, nance fruit, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es:
OSCAR tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con los 3 hijos en el Recinto Rancho Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas.

La VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Abchoveta, pertenece al cantòn Pueblo viejo se ddeican a labores agrícolas.

OSCAR se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, soya. Soliciat el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, anonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra.

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas . El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las palgas y la competencia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old, single, and lives with his three children in the precinct of Rancho Grande, which is in the canton of Ventanas.

The Communal Bank “Anchoveta” is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is located in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members engage in farm work.

Oscar is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and soybeans. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and compost. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers for the planting season. His purchases and sales are conducted in Ventanas. The challenges he faces include dealing with diseases and the competition.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and compost.

loans.name: Ivannia

texts.es:
Ivannia, es una mujer joven que desde muy temparano inicia su participación en actividades comerciales, ella por una situación familiar de enfermedad de su esposo quien es incapacitado permanentemente, decide instalar en su casa un bazar, como actividad que le generará ingresos y así apoyar el presupuesto familiar.
Ella vive en una comunidad rural, en un proyecto habitacional de condiciones sociomarginales, con carencia de fuentes de trabajo asalariadas, por lo que las pequeñas microenmpresa son una alternativa para generar ingresos.
Ella tiene como obstáculo la falta de recurso económico para hacer toda la tramitología de los permisos y tener el capital para surtir y acondicionar el espacio físico.
El ser apoyada con crédito le permitirá que el negocio vaya creciendo , diversificar los productos y para ella y su familia mejorar calidad de vida y estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ivannia is a young woman who started engaging in business activities very early. Due to a family situation in which her husband was left permanently disabled as a result of an illness, Ivannia decided to establish a bazaar in her home. This business generates income to provide for her family’s finances.

Ivannia lives in a rural community, in a housing project that has marginal socioeconomic conditions and lacks any source of salaried jobs. For this reason, small businesses provide an alternative means of generating income.

Ivannia’s obstacle is the lack of financial resources required for all the paperwork needed to obtain permits. She also does not have the capital for inventory and renovations to her physical space. With the help of a loan, she will be able to grow her business, diversify her products, and provide a better quality of life and financial stability for herself and her family.

loans.use: to remodel her shop and to buy merchandise to sell in her bazaar.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née en Février 1975 à Sikasso, Mariam est veuve et mère de 3 enfants qui  réside chez son feu époux et avec ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mariam, après plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié depuis plus de dix années à cette activité de petit commerce notamment l’achat et vente de vêtements, de pagne wax, de sacs à main et de tissus brodé. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre à sa place à Sikasso où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des des femmes de ménages et vendeuses de condiments) pour la qualité.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’une année. Elle est à son deuxième prêt, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Ainsi, elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 30 pièces de pagne wax, 25 complets de tissus brodé et 25 sacs à main. Elle envisage réaliser avec ce crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 155 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in February 1975 in Sikasso, Mariam is a widow and the mother of three children. She and her children live in her ​​late husband's dwelling in a nuclear family in Wayerma I, one of the neighborhoods in the periphery of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After several unsuccessful activities, Mariam began ten years ago a small business activity involving the purchase and sale of clothing, pagne wax (colorful West-African fabric), handbags and embroidered fabrics. 

She buys her goods in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) before reselling them at home in Sikasso where her goods are in high demand by her customers (mainly composed of household women and condiment vendors) due to their quality.

In order to better serve her increasing number of customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution over a year ago. This is her second loan, the previous loan having been correctly repaid.

She is requesting a second loan to increase her working capital in order to buy 30 lengths of pagne wax, 25 complete sets of embroidered clothing and 25 handbags. She plans to achieve monthly profits of 155,000 FCFA which will be used to contribute towards family expenses, pay interest on the loan and invest the rest in her activity.

loans.use: buy clothing and handbags

loans.name: Dusu

texts.en:
Dusu is 40 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and has living conditions that are much better than the capital city of Liberia. It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

She did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniqulle. Traditionally, she is married, and her husband is a farmer; they have four children between 18 and 24. She said that only two of her children are in school, and they all live in the same house that was built by her husband.

With a little money from her husband, she was able to establish her table business eight years ago, where she sells lappa (traditional cloth). She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. Some problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She thanks BRAC Liberia supporters.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a Kiva borrower. She has five children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail shop where she sells maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, salt and other food items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be an increase in food prices. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and other food items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesslady. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and other food items.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Kou lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and has better living conditions than the capital city of Liberia. It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniqulle. Traditionally, she is married, and her husband is a farmer; they have six children between 5 and 18 years old, she said, and only five of her children are in school. They all live in the same house which was built by her children's father.

With a little money from her husband, she was able to establishe her table business four years ago, where she sells fashion slippers. She spends eight hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. Some problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house. She appreciate the lenders of Kiva for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Nouhoum

texts.fr:
Né vers 1976 à  Ségou, Monsieur  Nouhoum est un  polygame résidant avec son épouse et leurs 2 enfant à Kaboîla II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Nouhoum  n’ayant pas la eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, s’est initié à l’activité de la blanchisserie traditionnelle depuis maintenant  huit ans. Il mène son activité aux abords de la route RN7 de son quartier où il dispose de son atelier de blanchisserie traditionnelle. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de son travail et de sa ponctualité. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel qui servira à acheter,  4 pilons pour battre les habits, 10 nattes et une 1 moto Jakarta pour pouvoir récupérer  et remettre les habits des clients qui  sont un peu loin de son atelier.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1976 in Segou, Mr. Nouhoum is a polygamist living with his wife and two children in Kaboîla II, one of the populous neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having had the opportunity to go to school and after conducting a lot of unsuccessful activities, Mr. Nouhoum became involved in providing traditional laundry services over eight years ago.

He conducts its business in the vicinity of the RN7 road in his neighborhood where he runs a traditional laundry workshop. He is much sought after by his clients for the quality of his work and his punctuality.

In order to better serve an increasing number of customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is his first individual loan he will use to buy four wooden bats to beat clothes, ten mats and a Jakarta motorcycle to retrieve and return the clothes of customers who live far from his workshop.

He plans to achieve monthly profits of 90,000 FCFA which will be used to contribute towards family expenses, pay interest on the loan and invest the rest in his activity.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: María Teodolinda

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años de edad, madre soltera de 8 hijos; pero solo una hija menor vive con ella que esta cursando el sexto grado. Se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace 5 años ya que tiempo atrás vivió en el país de belize  realizando  tareas domesticas; pero  un día se dio  cuenta que en su país se podía  salir adelante  y es así  como regreso  a El Salvador con la esperanza de emprender   un negocio  que le permitiera  a ella  y a sus hijos salir a delante. Es así  como  en una conversación con una amiga le comento  de la oportunidad  que existe en la comercialización de los pollos de engorde ya aliñados generando interés en María de poder emprender esta actividad.

El principal insumo  que la señora compra es el pie de cría , los pollos de  un día de nacidos  y  luego  los concentrados  en  2 modalidades, inicio  y engorde, los cuales los compra en un lugar ubicado   en el  centro  de la ciudad a 15 minutos de su vivienda  y los traslada en un pick up.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación campo, es para comprar concentrado  de engorde final  para sacar la camada de pollos que tienen de 4 semanas  y el resto  para  la compra  de una nueva camada de pollitos para continuar con el ciclo  productivo  y  no  parar por  falta de fondos.

la necesidad satisfecha  con el préstamo  será  la continuidad de los ciclos productivos  para no perder la clientela  que  ya tiene  y  así mantener siempre  la actividad para llevar sustento  a los miembros de su  familia .

 El impacto en la calidad de vida será directo ya que  se aumentara  la productividad del negocio ya que  se estarán generando  mayores ganancias  y atrayendo  más clientes para mantener la inversión de manera continúa.


A futuro  la  señora, planea aumentar  la productividad de su negocio  con el fin de darle la oportunidad a la ultima de sus hijas, que actualmente esta cursando  el 6° año de educación básica de culminar sus estudios de educación media  y por que no  también la educación superior.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old and a single mother with eight children. However, only one young daughter still lives with her since she is currently in the sixth grade.

María has been raising chickens for fattening for the past five years. Before that, she lived in the country of Belize where she worked as a household domestic. One day she found out that her homeland could move forward, so she returned to El Salvador in hopes of starting a business that would allow her and her children to succeed. As a result of a conversation with a friend, the opportunity to sell fattened chickens stimulated María’s interest to establish this type of business.

Sra. María’s main business input is the purchase of breeding chickens. When she has chicks that are newly hatched, they can be used for two purposes: sold as-is or fattened. She buys her chickens at a place that is located in the central part of the city, which is 15 minutes from her home. Maria travels in a pickup truck.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy concentrated feed for a batch of chickens that is four weeks old. The rest of the money will be used to buy a new batch of chicks in order to continue the productive cycle without having to stop due to a lack of funds. Since the loan will satisfy this need, Maria can continue to be productive without having to worry about losing her existing customers. She can maintain her business in order to support the members of her family.

Increasing the productivity of her business will have a direct impact on her quality of life. She will be able to generate more income, attract more customers, and maintain her investment. In the future, Sra. María plans to increase her business productivity so that she can provide opportunity for her youngest daughter, who is currently in the sixth grade. Maria hopes that her daughter goes on to finish high school since she cannot provide for a higher education.

loans.use: to buy concentrated poultry feed and a batch of newly hatched chicks.

loans.name: Bafina  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Bafina 1 sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Saguélé dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but de recruter l’association des jeunes pour effectuer le sarclage de son champ et d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver uniquement de  l’arachide.
Madame Minata (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite  vers la gauche 
sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs  d’urée, un bidon d’herbicide, 50kg de grains d’arachide et utiliser l’association des jeunes du village pour faire le désherbage. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à Siby. Avec une superficie de 1,50 ha, elle espère récolter 60 sacs d’arachide. Une partie de la production d’arachide sera vendue pour prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en produits de premières nécessités et le reste serait auto consommé en famille. Madame Minata a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans son foyer.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Bafina 1 group are married for the most part in large traditional families. They are on average 42 years old with four children. 

They all live in the village of Saguélé in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through kinship, marriage and neighborhood ties.

In order to recruit the youth association to do the weeding in their field and have agricultural inputs available to them at the beginning of the rainy season, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third seasonal loan cycle. Group members only grow groundnuts.

Mrs. Minata (the woman sitting in the second position from right to left in the picture) plans to use the loan to buy two bags of urea, a container of herbicide, 50kg of groundnut kernels and have the village's youth association do the weeding.

She buys her agricultural inputs in Siby. With an area of ​​1.5 ha (3.7 acres), she hopes to harvest 60 bags of groundnuts. Part of the groundnut production will be sold to support basic household necessities and the rest is destined for family consumption.

Mrs. Minata's aim is to ensure nutritional self-sufficiency for her home.

loans.use: To buy groundnut kernels, urea, herbicides and hire men for weeding.

loans.name: Victoria Dolores

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 73 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, una mujer de 35 y un hombre de 37 años de edad ambos trabajan en la agricultura. Tiene 52 años de vivir en la comunidad ella se ha dedicado la mayoría de tiempo a la agricultura; actividad que realizo por lo menos 30 años,  sin embargo en los últimos años se ha dedicado a los servicios domestico por más de 15 años cuidando a los hijos de los patrones donde ella ha trabajado toda su vida.

El crédito lo solicita para pagar el alquiler de unas tierras y sembrar en ellas ya que son aproximadamente 14,000 metros cuadrados, siembra la mitad de maíz y la otra de maicillo y una parte para postrera.
 
Una de las primeras necesidades en satisfacer es la obtención de ingresos a la familia, además de poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, ya que prácticamente le compran ambas cosechas, es poco el producto que les queda a ellos para consumir, y unas de las principales es dar trabajo a sus familiares ya que son estos los que se encargan de trabajar la tierra, debido a que ella no puede ver bien.

Espera tener una mejor estabilidad económica y alimenticia con las entradas de dinero por la venta de las cosechas, piensan pagar el crédito además de poder levantar una de las paredes que se encuentra en mal estado por los años, además de poder brindar trabajo a los familiares.   

Su sueño es, poder comprar los  terrenos que les alquilan ya que el dueño esta con la intención de venderles; por lo cual ellos ya piensan en un crédito a futuro para comprar, además ella quiere que la casa quede en perfecto estado, para brindar un hogar con mejores instalaciones.
texts.en:
Victoria is 73 years old. She is single and a mother of two adult children, a woman of 35 and a man of 37, who both work in agriculture. She has lived in her community for 52 years, and she has spent most of that time working in agriculture, which she began at least 30 years ago. However, she has also worked in domestic services for the last 15 years, caring for the children of the employers where she has worked her entire life. 

The loan she is seeking is to pay rent on some fields and plant them. They are about 14,000 square meters and she plants half with corn, half with sorghum, and part for the second harvest. 
 
One of the first needs she must satisfy is obtaining income for her family, and she must also satisfy the needs of her clients, because they end up purchasing both her harvests. Little of the product is left for her family to eat. One of the main things is that she gives work to her family members; they are the ones who are responsible for working the land, because she cannot see well.

She hopes to have more economic and nutritional stability with the inflow of money from selling the harvests. In addition to giving work to family members, they are also thinking about using the loan to pay for the repair of a wall that has been in bad shape for years. 

Her dream is to be able to buy the fields she currently rents, because the owner intends to sell them, so they are thinking about a loan in the future to buy them. She also wants the house to be in perfect condition, to provide a home with better facilities.

loans.use: to pay rent on some fields and plant seeds on them. They are about 14,000 square meters and she plants half with corn, half with sorghum, and a part for the second harvest.

loans.name: Amor De Mujeres Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias exitosas una de ellas es María mujer de 53 años de edad, casada, con un hijo menor de 6 años. Su negocio es la venta de comida desde hace 3 años, vende sus productos en su comunidad. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución desde hace 3 años. El crédito lo solicita para invertir el comprar una cocina industrial. Raquel mujer de 33 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de juguetes y Paula tiene 55 años de edad y su negocio es crianza y venta de pollos, zapatos y cosméticos
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful members. One of them is María, a 53-year-old woman who is married and has a six-year-old son. She has been in the business of selling food for three years. Her products are sold in her community. María has been a client of ADIM for three years. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of an industrial stove.

Raquel is a 33-year-old woman who has a business of selling toys. Paula is 55 years old and has a business of raising and selling chickens. She also sells shoes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove.

loans.name: Los Pere Group

texts.es:
El señor Eliseo esta casado, cuenta con 25 años de edad, curso 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos que aun no estudian, él se dedica a la siembra de ejoes, inició este negocio ayudando a sus padres y hasta la fecha tiene 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para la siembra de ejote, en el futuro desea incrementar sus cosechas y desea sembrar otros hortalizas. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de ejote, pepino y tomates. En la fotografia aparecen 10 integrantes, pero, solamente a 7 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sr. Eliseo is 25 years old, married, and completed three years of his primary school education. He has two children, but they are not studying. Eliseo grows green beans. He started this business with the help of his parents and now has five years of experience.

Eliseo organized a group so that he could request a loan. He will use the money to buy supplies for planting green beans. In the future, he hopes to increase his yields so that he can plant other vegetables.

The other members of the group grow green beans, cucumbers, and tomatoes. The photograph shows 10 members, but only 7 of them are participating in this loan.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for planting green beans.

loans.name: Benkan  1 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées  majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants, les membres du groupe BENKAN 1 vivent toutes dans le village de Kenioro dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but de recruter l’association des jeunes pour effectuer le sarclage de son champ et d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver le riz et  l’arachide.
Madame Natènè (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande productrice d’arachide dans le village. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs d’engrais constitués  d’urée et de complexe céréales, un litre d’herbicide, 50kg de grains d’arachide et utiliser l’association des jeunes du village pour effectuer le labour et  le désherbage. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à Siby. Avec une superficie de 1,50ha, elle espère récolter 40 sacs d’arachide et 5 sacs de riz. Une partie de la production serait vendue pour assurer les besoins du foyer en au quotidien et le reste serait auto consommé en famille.
texts.en:
Mostly married in large traditional families with an average of 39 years of age and five children, the members of the Benkan 1 group all live in the village of Kenioro in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through family, marriage and neighborhood ties.

To recruit the youth association to cultivate their field and ensure agricultural inputs are available at the beginning of the rainy season, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third seasonal loan cycle. The group will grow rice and groundnuts.

Mrs. Natène (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) is a major groundnut producer in the village.

She plans to use the loan to buy four bags of fertilizer consisting of urea and a mixture of grains, one liter of herbicide, 50 kgs of groundnut kernels, and hire the village youth association to perform plowing and weeding. She gets her agricultural inputs in Siby.

With an area of ​​1.50 ha (3.7 acres) she hopes to harvest 40 bags of groundnuts and 5 bags of rice. Part of the production is sold to ensure household daily needs and the rest is used for family consumption.

loans.use: To buy groundnut kernels, fertilizers, herbicides and use men to do the plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Sabougnouma  1 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées  majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 46 ans et 3 enfants, les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 1 vivent toutes dans le village de Kongola dans la région de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver le riz et  l’arachide.
Madame Korotoumou (femme debout en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans le village pour sa grande productivité d’arachide. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs d’urée, 4 litres d’herbicide  et utiliser la main d’œuvre masculine pour effectuer le labour. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à Siby. Avec une superficie de 2,50ha, elle espère récolter 60 sacs d’arachide et 5 sacs de riz. Une partie de la production serait vendue pour assurer les besoins du foyer en au quotidien et le reste serait auto consommé en famille.
texts.en:
Mostly married in large traditional families with an average of 46 years of age and three children, the members of the Sabougnouma 1 group all live in the village of Kongola in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through family, marriage and neighborhood ties.

To ensure agricultural inputs are available at the beginning of the rainy season, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third seasonal loan cycle. The group will grow rice and groundnuts.

Mrs. Korotoumou (the woman standing in third position from right to left in the photo) has a great reputation in the village for her high groundnut productivity.

She plans to use the loan to buy two bags of urea, four liters of herbicide, and use male labor to do the plowing. She resupplies agricultural inputs in Siby.

With an area of ​​2.5 ha (6.2 acres), she hopes to harvest 60 bags of peanuts and 5 bags of rice. Part of the production is sold to ensure household daily needs and the rest is used for family consumption.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicides, and hire men to do the plowing

loans.name: Jose Jovanny

texts.es:
JOSE tiene 35 años de edad es divorsiado tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Vnetanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

JOSE dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizanes, herbcidas, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. 

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es seguir en la agricultura.
El sueño es es comprar tierra para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer hacerca de la agricultura.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old. He is divorced and has two children. He lives with his children in Ventanas canton, in the province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the communal bank “La Chonta”, which is located in the rural community of La Chonta, in Ventanas canton. The members make a living from farming and working with livestock.

Jose makes a living from agriculture. He plants corn and soybeans. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his agricultural work. He will make his purchases in Ventanas.

The challenges he faces are continuing in agriculture.
His dream is to buy land in order to continue planting his crops. In his free time he likes to read about agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides

loans.name: Tomas Santos

texts.es:
Tomas cuenta con 58 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos de 35 y 28 años de edad respectivamente. La mayoría de tiempo se ha dedicado a la agricultura actividad que realizo por lo menos 48 años,  sin duda alguna tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad que realiza, además de poder realizar trabajos diversos como albañil, entre otros.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar abono y semilla, para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Estos insumos le hacen falta para terminar de sembrar ya que parte de esta cosecha ya esta comenzada.
 
Una de las primeras necesidades en satisfacer es la obtención de ingresos a la familia, además de poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, ya que prácticamente le compran la cosecha, además de poder saldar el crédito ya que es la primera prioridad para él.

Desea, comprar unas vaquitas ya que le interesa mucho lo del ganado, además de poder brindar una mayor educación a sus nietos ya que él desea verlos convertidos en profesionales, y poder ahorrar una pequeña cantidad para los gastos cuando ellos estén en una edad mas avanzada.
texts.en:
Tomas is 58 years old, married and has two children, aged 35 and 28 years old respectively.  The majority of Tomas' time is spent farming, work that he has been doing for at least 48 years.  Without a doubt he has much experience in farming and, in addition, can do other work, such as building.

Tomas is applying for a loan to buy manure and seeds in order to grow maize on 7000m2 of land.  Having already started sowing the crops, he needs these supplies so that he can finish the job.

One of Tomas' greatest needs is to earn an income for his family.  He also has to satisfy his customers' needs as they practically buy the whole harvest.  On top of that is Tomas' first priority, which is to be able to pay off the loan.

Tomas would like to buy some young cows as he is very interested in cattle.  He wants to provide his grandchildren with a better education as he wants them to grow up to become professionals.  Tomas wants to save up a little money to help his grandchildren with their costs when they are a little bit older.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds in order to grow maize on 7000m2 of land.-

loans.name: Essénam

texts.fr:
Essénam a 31 ans. Elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure à son domicile à Adidogomé. Son atelier est situé à côté du collège d’enseignement général du quartier. La majorité de ces clients est constitué des élèves et étudiantes. Après 6 ans d’activités, elle a ajouté la vente des pagnes afin de satisfaire ces clients. Essénam est accueillante et adore mettre à l’aise ses clients. Essénam a aussi associé la vente des mèches à son activité principale afin de proposer des différents types de mèches à ses clients et bénéficier de la marge sur vente. Vu la qualité de son service, elle reçoit assez de clients ce qui l'a amené à recruter des apprentis tresseuses dynamiques comme elle
Avec ce crédit, Essénam compte accroître ses capacités d’approvisionnement
texts.en:
Essénam is 31 years old. She runs a hair salon out of her home, in Adidogomé, near the general education college of the area. Most of her customers are students. After six years, she started to sell pagnes as well in response to customer demand. 

Essénam is a warm person who loves to put her customers at ease. She added the sale of hair extensions to her main activity, hoping that offering various types of extensions will bolster her profit margin. The quality of her services has helped her to build a good customer base, which in turn led to her hiring apprentice weavers who share her enthusiasm. 

Essénam plans to use this loan to stock up on supplies.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen hair extensions and 2 dozen hair weaves.

loans.name: Grâce

texts.fr:
Grâce est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans. Elle a 4 enfants et habite le quartier d’Agoè au nord est de Lomé.  Hérité de sa mère, Grâce a commencé le commerce de céréales depuis l’année 1982. 

Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans dans les fermes reculés de la capitale togolaise surtout en période d’abondance. Depuis qu’elle a démarré cette activité, elle n’a jamais obtenu un crédit dans une structure de microfinance. 

En ce début de vacances, elle souhaite augmenter son stock et sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de maïs et 07 bols de cossette (manioc séchés). Le revenu de ses activités lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de vendre en gros aux revendeuses du marché Assiyéyé.
texts.en:
Grâce is a 36-year-old married woman. She has four children and lives in the Agoè neighborhood, located in the north-east of Lomé. She inherited a cereal-selling business from her mother, and has been carrying out this activity since 1982.

Grâce gets her supplies from farms which are located at some distance from the Togo capital, particularly during times of great abundance. Since she started her business she has never taken out a microfinance loan. Now that the holidays are starting, Grâce wants to increase her stock, so has requested this loan to buy three bags of corn and seven bowls of dried cassava chips. The income she obtains from her business will allow her to increase her working capital, as well as to sell wholesale to the resellers located in Assiyéyé market.

loans.use: To buy three bags of corn and seven bowls of cassava chips.

loans.name: Djodji

texts.fr:
Djodji est une femme âgée de 26 ans et est mariée. Elle habite le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle a commencé la vente des produits de beauté et des pagnes depuis 2009. Elle est une revendeuse ambulante et parcours plus de 20km à pieds par jour. 

Il y a 5 ans elle s’approvisionne à crédit chez un grossiste au grand marché de Lomé ce qui ne lui permet pas de gagner beaucoup de bénéfice. Au début de cette année 2013, elle a rompu le contrat d’achat à crédit avec son grossiste et a continué son activité avec ses faibles moyens. 

Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de pagne et des produits cosmétiques afin d'accroitre son chiffre d’affaires.
texts.en:
Djodji is a 26-year-old married woman, who lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. She started selling beauty products and pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth] in 2009, and works reselling these items on the street. She walks more than 20 kilometers by foot each day.

Five years ago Djodji started getting her supplies on credit from a wholesaler in the Grand Market of Lomé, which didn’t allow her to make much profit. At the start of 2013 she terminated this credit contract with the wholesaler, and has kept her business going with her meager resources. The loan Djodji has requested will allow her to increase her stock of pagnes and cosmetic products, so that her business can generate more income.

loans.use: To buy three dozen cosmetic creams and six lengths of pagne cloth

loans.name: Abibata

texts.fr:
Abibata est une femme dynamique âgée de 39 ans qui aime beaucoup le commerce. Elle est mariée et a 05 personnes à charge. 

En 1992, elle avait démarré la vente des tubercules (igname) dans son quartier à Agoè. Très tôt elle a abandonné compte tenu du fait que les clients ne venaient pas acheter à temps et que les ignames pourrissent. Après son analyse, elle a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités pour permettre aux ménages de son quartier d’éviter de parcourir de longues distances pour faire leurs achats. 

Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock d’eau minérale. Le revenu de cette activité lui permet d’épargner et d’aider son mari dans les dépenses de leur famille.
texts.en:
Abibata is a dynamic, 39-year-old woman, who really enjoys her trade. She is married, and has five people under her care.

In 1992, Abibata started off by selling tubers (yams) in her neighborhood in Agoè. She soon stopped working in this business, however, due to the fact that her customers wouldn’t come to buy the yams on time, and they would go bad. After analyzing the situation, she decided to open a store selling staple goods, so that the people living in her neighborhood didn’t have to travel long distances to do their shopping.

Abibata has requested her first loan to increase her stock of mineral water. The income she receives from this business will allow her to save, as well as to help her husband to cover the family’s expenses.

loans.use: To buy ten boxes of containers filled with mineral water.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Âgée de 37 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée et a 4 enfants. Elle habite le quartier de Vakpossito au nord de Lomé. En 2009, elle a fait le commerce de pate dentifrice en se promenant de quartier en quartier. Trois ans d’activité après, elle a pu économiser un peu d’argent pour enfin démarré en 2012 l’activité de fabrication et de vente des gâteaux localement appelé (Africa tennis). 

La fabrication de ces gâteaux nécessite la farine de blé, du sucre et bien d’autres ingrédients et elle s’approvisionne dans une boutique de son quartier de résidence. Elle passe près de 4 heures de temps par jour pour mener cette activité. Son lieu d’activité est situé sous un arbre au bord d’une rue souvent pratiquée par beaucoup de personnes.
 
Ce crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter deux sacs de farine de blé et 10 litres d’huile végétale.
texts.en:
Akossiwa, age 37, is married with four children. She lives in the area of Vakpossito, north of Lomé. In 2009, she started selling toothpaste as an itinerant vendor, going from district to district. In 2012, after three years in this activity, she had saved enough money to launch a new business making and selling a type of beignet locally called “Africa tennis”. 

She makes these beignets with wheat flour, sugar, and many other ingredients, which she buys at a local shop where she lives. She devotes nearly four hours a day to this new activity. She conducts her business under a tree on a street that often sees heavy traffic. 

She will use her new loan to buy two sacks of wheat flour and 10 liters of vegetable oil.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of wheat flour and 10 liters of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1980. She has two children who are in 1st and 3rd grades. Her husband is a bicycle and motorbike repairer. His income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. Phuong sells groceries to earn a living and has been in this job for seven years. Phuong earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 6,500,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is lacking capital to invest in her grocery store and lacking money to pay for her children’s education. Her dream is to open a bigger grocery store and have a fuller life. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. Phuong is a hardworking woman and a passionate businessman. She likes this job because she can work at home and care for her family.

She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy beer, beverages, biscuits, noodles and ice cream for her grocery store. She always wants to expand her business and help her children grow up well.

loans.use: to buy beer, beverages, biscuits, noodles and ice cream for her grocery store.

loans.name: Irène Abra

texts.fr:
Irène est une femme dynamique âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle est une revendeuse ambulante d’habits et des sous-vêtements de femme dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2008 et n’a pas rencontré de difficulté de majeure. 

Elle s’approvisionne deux  (2) fois par semaine au grand marché compte tenu de la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement ce qui lui revient trop cher.

Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 3 douzaines d’habit et 4 douzaines de sous-vêtement afin d’augmenter son stock et accroître son chiffre d’affaires.
texts.en:
Irène is a dynamic 41-year-old woman, who is married and has two children. She works reselling women’s clothing and underwear on the streets of the Adidogomé neighborhood. She has been working in this business since 2008, and has not had to face any major obstacles.

Irène gets her supplies twice a week in the main market. She only stocks up twice a week due to her low working capital, as otherwise it would be too expensive. She has requested this loan to buy three dozen pieces of clothing and four dozen items of underwear, so that she can increase her stock and her turnover.

loans.use: To buy three dozen pieces of clothing and four dozen items of underwear.

loans.name: Noeline

texts.fr:
Noeline est née dans la préfecture du Golfe à Agoè. A 37 ans, Noeline est une jeune femme mariée avec à sa charge quatre (04) enfants. Elle est une revendeuse de chaussure, de fruit, de biscuits et de l’eau glacée. 

Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2003 dans son quartier à Agoè. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché d’Adidogomé où l’on retrouve des fruits venant de la ville des fruits (Kpalimé). 

Noeline sollicite ce prêt pour accroitre le volume de son activité afin de satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante qu’elle reçoit surtout en ces périodes de ramadan. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter son revenu et par conséquent donner une dignité à sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Noeline was born in the Golfe prefecture, in Agoè. She is 37 years old and married with four dependent children. She sells shoes, fruits, cookies and iced water. She started this activity in 2003 in her neighborhood of Agoè. She buys her stock at the market of Adidogomé where she can get fruit from Kpalimé, a city known for its fruit production. 

Noeline is seeking a loan to bolster her activity and better meet the needs of a growing customer base, especially during the period of Ramadan. This will allow her to increase her income and to boost her children’s sense of dignity.

loans.use: to buy five baskets of fruits and one carton of cookies.

loans.name: Iris Madahí

texts.es:
Iris es una joven de 24 años de edad, soltera, la mayor parte del tiempo vive sola, ya que su mamá es comerciante y viaja mucho. Ella, vende productos de limpieza personal, ropa, esto lo hace desde hace ya más de 6 años, por lo cual la clientela es grande y preferencial.  Los productos los vende en la comunidad y en los caseríos cercanos, cuando solo lo hace en la comunidad no camina mucho pero cuando lo hace en los alrededores puede recorrer una distancia de hasta 50 kilómetros, por día ya que los productos los vende de forma ambulante.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar cremas, desodorantes, aceites aromáticos, artículos de higiene personal de mejores marcas, ya que muchos clientes preguntan por estos productos nuevos y ella muchas veces no los carga, además de comprar más fardos de ropa para vender.

Espera mejorar la  estabilidad económica y alimenticia de la familia, también ella con esta entrada de ingresos quiere estudiar una pequeña carrera de cosmetología, e instalar una sala de belleza.   

Su deseo es, formar un hogar estable, comprar su propio terreno y construir su propia vivienda, así poder brindarse un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Iris is 24 years old and single.  Most of the time she lives alone as her mother is a saleswoman and travels a lot.  Iris sells personal cleaning products and clothes.  She has been doing this work for over six years so she now has many loyal customers.  Iris sells her products in the community and nearby villages.  When she is only working in the local community, Iris does not walk very much but when she heads out to the surrounding areas, she works as a street vendor and can walk up to 50 kilometres per day.

Iris is applying for this loan in order to buy creams, deodorants, aromatic oils, and personal hygiene products from better brands as many customers are asking after these products, which Iris does not often have.  Iris will also buy more bundles of clothes to sell.

Iris is hoping to become more financially stable and to feed the family.  In addition, with this income, she would like to study to become a beautician and set up a beauty salon.

Iris's wish is to have a stable home, to buy her own land and to build her own home so that she can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy creams, deodorants, aromatic oils, and personal hygiene products from better brands.

loans.name: Las Pascuas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres emprendedoras mujeres una de ellas es Linda tiene 25 años de edad, acompañada, con cuatro hijos que dependen de ella. Su negocio es la venta de frutas desde hace 10 años, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado. El crédito lo solicita para la comprar frutas como banano, naranja, melón, piña, aguacate, etc. Francis tiene 26 años de edad  y su negocio es la venta de banano y Hipolita tiene 57 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising women.  One member is Linda.  She is 25 years old and has a partner, and four children who depend on her.  Linda has had a business selling fruits for ten years.  She sells her products in the market.  She is applying for a loan to buy fruits such as bananas, oranges, melons, pineapples and avocado.  Francis is 26 years old and sells bananas.  Hipolita is 57 years old and has a business selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as bananas, oranges, melons, pineapples and avocado.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew is a married man, and has four children. He describes himself as hopeful. 

Matthew operates a retail shop where he sells maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, salt and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are local residents. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to add stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and other items to his shop. 

His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a pick up vehicle. He also sells cows to earn extra income. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and other items to his retail shop.

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is 38 years old, and lives in Sanniquelle, which is the capital city of Nimba County. It is an area rich in nature resources, and living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is also the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Louis described herself as a hard-working woman. She did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniquelle. In accordance with tradition, she is married; her husband is a farmer, and they have four children aged between 20 and 8 years old. Only one of her children is in school. The whole family live in the same house which was built by her husband. 

Using a little money from her husband, Louis was able to establish her business ten years ago. She sells palm oil, salt and pepper, and she spends eight 8 hours working on her business, from Monday to Saturday. 

One of the problems she faces is a small income. Louis is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt and pepper for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 27 years old. She has two children who are learning at the 2nd grade and at kindergarten. Her husband breeds pigs and sells fruits in a market to earn a living. He earns about 6,000,000VND per month. 

Thanh is a worker. Her income is about 6,000,000VND per month. She has done this job for one year. In addition, she also breeds pigs and grows rice to earn more money. Her challenge in life and work is a lack of capital to invest in her pig-raising and to buy more fruits to sell. Her dreams are to have a breeding farm and to buy a truck to transport fruits. 

This loan is one of the steps that will help her reach this dream. She is a hard-working woman and a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA’s micro finance program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000VND. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000VND to buy more pigs to breed. She will use profit to build a farm and buy a truck.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kampala, and is married with one child who goes to school. She also takes care of two additional family members. 

Susan sells chips at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years, and works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bag of potatoes, some cooking oil and spices. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to open up a restaurant and also build a house. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy a bag of potatoes, some cooking oil and serving utensils.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children, none of whom go to school. Mary also takes care of other additional family members.

She sells charcoal at the market on wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last ten years. She works seven days a week.
