Mary has no other source of income. She has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting her charcoal to the market. Her major monthly expenses include medication and food.

loans.use: to more bags of charcoal to sell at the market.

loans.name: Sosan

texts.en:
27- year-old Sosan lives in Sanniquelle, which is the capital city of Nimba County, Liberia. It is an area rich in nature resources, and living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is also the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Sosan did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniquelle. She is single, and has two children aged 7 and 4 years old. Only one of her children is in school; and they all live at home.

With a little money from her mother, she was able to establish her table business four years ago, where she sells rice, oil and pepper, along with other items. She spends nine hours a day working, from Monday to Saturday.

One problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil and pepper, along with other items, for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house. She appreciates the lender of Kiva for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper and other items for her business.

loans.name: Benkaditon 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Benkaditon 2 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Massalawere dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Menata Y (2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Massalawere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter de petits équipements,  des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women of the group called Benkaditon 2 are all married in traditional families. They average 36 years old and have on average five children. They all live in the village of  Massalawere in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met because of their rainy season agricultural work, or through being neighbors or in-laws, or thorough relatives in the village. 

They grow  peanuts, millet and rice. In order to buy small equipment and to stock up on agricultural inputs, the members of the group found Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second cycle of seasonal loans. 

Madame Menata Y (second woman standing from left to right in the photo) works hard at her rainy season agricultural activities in the village of Massalawere.  She intends to use her loan to buy small equipment, seeds and fertilizer and to pay young people to weed her field. She sells her agricultural produce for cash, at the end of the rainy season, to repay her loan and to have income to cover children's expenses as well as part of the family's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds, and farm inputs.

loans.name: Djantoyerela 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Djantoyerela 2 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 47ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Bounou. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne.

Madame Mahawa (1ère femme debout au bout à gauche dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Bounou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Djantoyerela 2 group are all married in traditional families. They, on average, are 47 years old and have five children. They all live in the Bounou, in the region of Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other from their farming in the rainy season, and from neighborhood, marriage, and family ties in the village.

This group grows groundnuts, millet, and rice. With the goal of buying small pieces of equipment and supplying themselves with farm inputs, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second loan cycle of the season. 

Mahawa (the first woman standing on the far left in the photo) leads farming during the rainy season in Bounou. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, buy seeds and fertilizers, and then to pay some young people to weed her field. 

At the end of the rainy season, sales of the crops are made for cash to pay back her loan and to have income to support her children and a part of her family.

loans.use: to plow and weed her field and to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Djantoyerela 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Djantoyerela 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 41ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Bounou. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne.

Madame Bintou B. (1ère femme debout au bout à gauche dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Bounou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Djantoyerela 3 group are all married in traditional families. They, on average, are 41 years old and have four children. They all live in Bounou, in the region of Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other from their farming in the rainy season, and from neighborhood, marriage, and family ties in the village.

This group grows groundnuts, millet, and rice. With the goal of buying small pieces of equipment and supplying themselves with farm inputs, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second loan cycle of the season.

Bintou B. (the first woman standing on the left in the photo) leads farming during the rainy season in Bounou. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, buy seeds and fertilizers, and then to pay some young people to weed her field.

At the end of the rainy season, sales of the crops are made for cash to pay back her loan and to have income to support her children and a part of her family.

loans.use: to plow and weed her field and to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Djantoyerela 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Djantoyerela 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 41ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Bounou. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne.
	
Madame Fatoumata (1ère femme debout au bout à gauche dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Bounou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ acheter de petits équipements, des semences, et des intrants. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Djantoyerela 1 group are married and live in traditional families. They, on average, are 41 years old and have two children. They all live in Bounou in the region of Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other from their farming in the rainy season and through neighborhood, marriage, and family ties.

This group grows groundnuts, millet, and rice. With the goal of buying small pieces of equipment and supplying themselves with farm inputs, the members of the group [joined] Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second loan cycle of the season.

Fatoumata (the women standing on the far left in the photo) leads the farming during the rainy season in Bounou. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, buy seeds and fertilizers, and then to pay some young people to weed her field and [also] to buy small pieces of equipment, seeds, and farm inputs.

At the end of the rainy season, sales of the crops are made for cash to pay back her loan and to have income to support her children and a part of her family.

loans.use: to plow and weed her field and to buy seeds, fertilizers and small pieces of equipment

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Hai is 45 years old. She has two children who have stable jobs. To earn a living, her husband is a constructional materials transporter. He earns about 7,000,000 VND per month. Hai breeds pigs to earn additional money. She has done this job for 20 years. She earns 3,000,000 VND per month. 

Aside from that, Hai helps her husband in his work. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking enough capital to expand her breeding farm. She wishes she could build houses for her sons. This loan will help her to attain this dream. She can invest in her pig-raising business to increase her earnings. Hai is a hardworking woman.

Hai has participated in SEDA's micro-finance program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more pigs to expand her breeding farm. She will use the profits to build a house and a new farm. 

Other members who are part of Hai's group include the following: 

Ly is 40 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to sell building materials. 

Mo is 44 years old. She has three children. She makes food to sell. She wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to invest in her business.

Thi is 36 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to breed chickens and pigs. 

Hau is 23 years old. She has a child. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to expand her breeding farm.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is a 53-year-old widow. She has two children who are married. One of them sells rice to earn a living. Hien sells pork in the market. Aside from that, she also has a farm and raises pigs to earn more money. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 20 years. 

Hien’s challenge in life and work is that she works alone so she can’t make a lot of food to sell. Her dream is to open her own grocery store. This loan is one of the steps that will help her reach this dream. She will be able to buy more food to sell, enabling her to gain earnings. Hien is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. 

She has participated in SEDA's micro-finance program since 2010. In her last loan cycle, she was loaned 8,288,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more food to sell to gain earnings.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to gain earnings.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang is 42 years old. She has two children. The older one is married. The young one is learning in school. Giang and her husband raise pigs and make rolls of meat to earn a living. Her husband earns about 3,000,000 VND and Giang earns about 7,000,000 VND per month. Aside from that, she also bakes cakes to sell at the market. She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Giang's challenge in life and work is that her breeding farm is wet and low. Her dream is to build a bigger and cleaner farm. This loan will help her reach this dream. She will be able to invest in her farm to gain earnings to attain this dream. 

Giang is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA's micro-finance program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid it on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more pigs to breed. She constantly seeks to expand her breeding farm.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 59 years old. She has six children. One of them is working in the Vietnamese army. The other children have got married. Her husband is a driver who transports workers to earn a living. He earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

Dung sells groceries and breeds pigs. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 22 years. Besides that, she is a short-term worker for buildings. Her family’s total income is about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is that her breeding facilities still are small so that she can’t raise any more pigs. Her dream is to build larger and cleaner breeding facilities. This loan is one of the steps that will help her reach her dream. Dung is a hardworking woman and a passionate businessman.

She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more pigs to breed. She will use the profit to build a new farm and invest in her children’s life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Bac's Group
loans.use: to buy more ducks to breed.

loans.name: Thinh's Group
loans.use: to buy more ingredients to cook andsell to workers.

loans.name: Van's Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Xuyen's Group

texts.en:
Xuyen is 49 years old. She has five children. Two of them have got married. The others are workers. Xuyen and her husband raise pigs and cook wine to earn a living. They earn about 3,000,000 VND per month each. They have done this job for 13 years. In addition, Xuyen also grows rice to earn more money. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

Xuyen’s challenge in life and work is that her family’s habitat is polluted because they just have a small place to live. Her dream is to have enough money to expand her animal breeding. This loan is one of the steps that will help her reach this dream. She can invest in her farm to gain more earnings and save the profit for her children’s marriage. Xuyen is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.

This is the first time she is participating in SEDA's microfinance program. In the first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy more pigs to expand her breeding farm.

Other members who are part of Xuyen's group include the following: 
- Nhan is 51 years old. She has a child. She is a worker and grows rice. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to expand her breeding farm.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong is 33 years old. She has three children. Two of them are learning at 10th and 8th grade. The last one is little. She and her husband sell buffalo meat and beef in a market to earn a living. They earn about 12,000,000 VND per month. They have done this job for 12 years. Besides that, Huong also grows rice to earn more money. Her challenge in work is the market is too far from her house, making transportation difficult and time-consuming. Her dream is to become a supplier buffalo meat and beef for neighborhoods. This loan is one of the steps that help her reach this dream. She can buy more buffalo and beef cows to breed. She is a hardworking and passionate businesswoman. 

Huong has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000  VND and repaid it on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND. She’ll use profit to invest in her business and raise her children well.

Other members who are part of Huong’s group include the following 

Bac is 27 years old. She has two children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to breed pigs
 Hoc is 49 years old. He has two children. He is a builder. He wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to invest in her work. 
Huong is 23 years old. She has two children. She makes carpentry. She wants to borrow 6,496,000VND to invest in her work
Quy is 60 years old. She has four children. She is a cleaner. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to breed pigs
San is 40 years old. He has two children. He raises buffalo and beeves. He wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to invest in her breeding

loans.use: to buy more buffalo and beef cows.

loans.name: Ngan's Group

texts.en:
Ngan was born in 1957. She has a son who is a worker and he earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She and her husband raise pigs to earn a living. They earn about 2,000,000 VND each month per person. Her family’s total income is about 9,000,000 VND per month. They have done this job for a long time. Her challenge in work is a lack of capital to breed pigs. Her dream is to build a more spacious and cleaner house. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. She can invest in her breeding to gain earnings and save the profit. She is a hardworking woman. Ngan has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more pigs to breed. She always wants to expand her breeding farm.
Other members who are part of Ngan’s group include the following:
Huong is 25 years old. She has two children. She cooks breakfast to sell. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy more ingredients to cook breakfast
Thiet is 23 years old. She has a child. She raises pigs. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in her breeding. 
Lien is 61 years old. She has two children. She sells cakes. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in her business

loans.use: to buy more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khanh was born in 1965. She has a child who is at university. She and her husband raise pigs, chickens, and birds to earn a living. They earn about 4,000,000 VND each month per person. They have done this job for a long time. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. Besides that, Khanh also makes soya curd to earn more money. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to invest in her breeding. Her dream is having enough capital to breed, so that she doesn’t need to borrow from anyone else. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. She can invest in her breeding farm to increase her earnings and save the profits. Khanh is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy more foods for her breeding farm. She always wants to expand her breeding.
Other members who are part of Khanh's group include the following:
 Du is 52 years old. She has three children. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to invest in her breeding. 
Chieu is 48 years old. She has two children. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to invest in her breeding. 
Cuc is 51 years old. She has six children. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to invest in her breeding. 
Luong is 49 years old. She has two children. She cooks food to sell. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more foods for her breeding farm.

loans.name: Mariscal Charapaqui Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARISCAL DE CHARAPAQUI”  iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Albertina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de maca, tejido de mantas, venta de zapatilla, venta de ropa, venta de zapatos, venta de hortalizas, hilado y tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Albertina es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de las asesoras de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías en mantas de vicuña; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace años con la compra de lana de vicuña para hilarla, decide realizar el tejido y comercializarlo, negocio que hasta ahora es rentable.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones en el área de crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The group  “MARISCAL DE CHARAPAQUI”  will begin their eighteenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada, an organization with 8 members and that is headed by Albertina,  the President. The businesses that the members of the association run are various and among them there is great diversity: selling turnips, knitting blankets, selling women's shoes, selling clothes, selling shoes in general, selling vegetables, thread and more.

The credit that they will take out will benefit the small businesses of the group that Albertina heads as President. She tells us that she became a member of Pro Mujer 8 years ago, being invited to join by one of the consultants that came to visit her in her home. Currently, she has a small business selling artisenal crafts such as blankets made from llama wool. She also tells us that in this business, she has learned how to purchase the wool and how to spin it and so she decided to also knit it and sell it, a business that has proven to be profitable. 

The credit that she will take out now will help her to increase her working capital in order to purchase more wool that she will acquire in the markets in the Ciudad de El Alto on wholesale and later she will knit it and sell the finished products in her store. This kind of work has allowed her to generate income that makes it possible for her to support her home and her 6 children. 

When she was asked what she would like from Pro Mujer, she said that she would like more training in loans and health.

loans.use: purchase llama wool.

loans.name: Binh's Group

texts.en:
Binh was born in 1971. She has two children, 1 daughter and 1 son. Her daughter has gotten married. Her son is a worker in the paper factory. Binh is a widow. Binh sells beverages from a stall to earn a living. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Her challenge in life and work is a lack of capital to invest in her beverage stall. Her dream is to have savings for her family’s life and to be able to travel to many places. This loan is one of the steps that will help her get to this dream. 

She can buy more beer to sell in order to gain earnings and save money for her children’s education. Binh is a hardworking woman and a passionate businessman. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000VND to buy more beer for her beverage stall. She has always wanted to remodel her beverage stall to make it better.
Other members which are part of Binh's group include the following:
	 Thai is 52 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to create a passenger car business. 
	 Thanh is 40 years old. She has three children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to sell carpentry work.
	 Hang is 49 years old. She has a child. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to sell recycled crushed material.
         Diep is 47 years old. She has a child. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy more beer for her beverage stall

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre soltero de 23  años de edad, vive junto a su primer hijo en el Sector La Cumbre, Barrio El Calvario, Sololá, Sololá.  
Es una persona amable y sobre todo trabajador, el se dedica a fabricar prendas de vestir típicos y bordados a maquina en el lugar de su vivienda, que son utilizados por  las mujeres indígenas de su región.
Inicio este trabajo hace 6 años,  porque su madre se dedicaba a esa labor por tal razón el decidió seguir los pasos de su madre ya que este tipo de actividad le genera ingresos y ganancias aceptables para cubrir las diferentes necesidades de su familia.
El ha observado que las prendas que fabrica tienen una gran demanda por lo que desea invertir más capital en su negocio, solicitando un préstamo de  Q 4,500.00 para comprar otra maquina de coser que le servirá para incrementar la cantidad de prendas y tener mejores ganancias.
Su sueño es comprar más maquinas de coser y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia a raíz de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is 23 years old, he lives with his first son in the area of La Cumbre, in the neighborhood El Calvario, Sololá, Sololá.  
He is a friendly and hard working person who dedicates himself to sewing typical clothing from his country and also does embroidery from home; products that are used by indigenous women in his region. 
He began this work 6 years ago because his mother is also in the business and so he thought he could follow in her footsteps, especially since this kind of work generates an income and profit enough to cover various family expenses.  
He has noticed that the articles of clothing that he makes are in great demand and so he wants to invest more capital into his business, applying for a loan in order to purchase a sewing machine that will help him to increase the number of clothing items he is able to produce and also increase his earnings. His dream is to purchase even more sewing machines and to improve his family's living conditions with the money he earns.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine to make clothes.

loans.name: El Hadj Samba

texts.fr: Monsieur   El   Hadj   Samba   est  marié   et    habite   au   Sénégal  depuis  sa  naissance. Il s’active depuis un an dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente d’huile de palme. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses de nourriture, de loyer et de transport pour sa famille. Il n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou il est membre.  Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat d’huile  de palme à revendre. Par  conséquent avec l’augmentation de ses bénéfices  il envisage de diversifier les produits  qu’il commercialise  et prévoit de démarrer la vente  de pate d’arachide. Il souhaite aussi  épargner de l’argent pour répondre aux exigences des imprévus et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet dans le futur consiste à acquérir un toit pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadj Samba is married and has been living in Senegal since he was born. For one year, he's been into the business of selling palm oil. 

The earning generated by his business enables him to cover the food, housing, and transport expenses for his family.  

He's a member of UIMCEC's local branch, but never sought any loan from it. He's now seeking a loan of XOF 100'000, intended to buy palm oil to resell.

With the expected increase in profits, he plans to diversify his product offering and intends to start selling peanut paste.

He also wishes to put money away to be able to face the unexpected and improve the feeding conditions of his family.

His future project consists in offering a roof to his family.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to resell

loans.name: Jireth Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios uno de ellos es José hombre de 49 años de edad, casado, con tres hijos de 22, 16, y 2 años. Su negocio es la venta de electrodoméstico desde hace  25 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de inventario como televisores, grabadoras, abanicos, DVD. Verónica mujer de 48 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería y María tiene 34  años de edad y su negocio es un taller de zapatería
texts.en: This group is made up of three members. One of them is José, a 49 year old man. He is married and has three children, aged 22, 16 and 2. His business has been selling appliances for 25 years. He will invest the loan in buying inventory such as televisions, recorders, fans, and DVDs. Verónica is a 48 year old woman, her business is a small store, and María is 34 years old, and her business is a shoemaking workshop.

loans.use: to invest in buying inventory of televisions, recorders, fans, and DVDs.

loans.name: Zem Taaba De Hati Group

texts.fr:
Mr HAMADO est responsable du groupe ZEM TAABA DE HATI. Marié, il est sans enfant et a 02 personnes en charge.

Mr vend des céréales depuis 01an. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Mr veut s’acheter 01sac de maïs et 01sac de mil.

Il veut épargner ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne agrandir son commerce afin de pouvoir réaliser ses vœux et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Hamado is the leader of Zem Taaba De Hati Group. He's married, without children, and has two people in his care.

He's been selling cereals for one year. He gets his supplies in the surrounding villages. His customers are men and women.

He wants to buy one sack of corn and one sack of millet. He wants to put away his profits in order to bolster his business.

He ambitions to expand his business in order to fulfill his wishes and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy one sack of corn and one sack of millet

loans.name: Bernardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Bernardo de 34 años de edad, es una persona muy conocida en la comunidad, es cliente por varios años de la fundación campo. Desde pequeño se ha crecido con sus padres, quienes a la vez le enseñaron ha ser una persona con valores y luchador en la vida. 

Él  creció trabajando en la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles) el cual le enseño su padre y sus hermanos mayores, hace 5 años se acompaño con su esposa con quien ha procreado un niño que ahora tiene 3 años y medio. Él todo el tiempo ha trabajado en la agricultura y trabajos de jornalero y ayudante de albañil, estudio hasta el nivel básico.

Compra los insumos agrícolas y de fertilizantes (abono, herbicidas, fungicidas, foliares) en la ciudad mas cercana que queda a 40 minutos en transporte urbano, él lo hace solo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono y herbicidas, invertirá un promedio de $300.00, tiene actualmente 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo y cancelara el alquiler para la próxima milpa que iniciara  en el mes de agosto. Con el préstamo, pretende, asegurar obtener una mejor cosecha del cultivo de maíz y frijoles, a la vez para asegurar el próximo cultivo que esta por iniciar en la comunidad.

Bernardo sueña comprar un terreno, ya que donde vive le ha dado su padre, pero él quiere tener su propio lugar (terreno) y así construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 34 years old and a well known person in his community. He has been a client of the organization Fundación Campo for a few years now. Since he was small he has grown up alongside his parents who taught him to be a person with strong values and to work hard in life. 

He grew up working in agriculture ( harvesting corn and beans), an occupation that his father and older brothers taught him. Five years ago he began to be accompanied by his wife who has also given birth to a son who is now 3 and a half years old. In all the time he has been working in agriculture and working as a day laborer and also as an assistant bricklayer, he has achieved a basic level of study. 

He purchases his agricultural supplies and fertilizers ( manure, herbicides, fungicides, fertilizer) in the nearest city that is about a 40 minute drive away. He does this on his own, alone. 

The loan that he is applying for with Fundación Campo is to be used to purchase fertilizer and herbicides. He currently has 7,000 square meters that he cultivates and he will pay off the rent for the milpa (plot of land used for agricultural purposes) for the month of August. With the loan, he wants to be able to secure a better harvest of corn and beans and also be able to guarantee the crop for next season, preparations for which will start soon in his community. 

Bernardo dreams of being to purchase land because the land he currently uses was given to him by his father, but he would love to own his own and he would also like to build his own home.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Bersalia

texts.es:
Bersalia, vive con su esposo de 60 años de edad,  su hija de 27 años de edad y su yerno de 30 años de edad y todos trabajan juntos. Ella se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, también a la crianza de aves de corral, asimismo realiza el oficio de costurera, lo realiza todos los días y lo desempeña desde hace 25 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, concentrado, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener los materiales agrícolas y alimentación para los animales.
Su sueño es adquirir más animales y obtener mayores ganancias con la cosecha de este año.
texts.en:
Bersalia lives with her 60 year old husband, her 27 year old daughter, and her 30 year old son in law. They all work together. She grows basic grains, such as corn and beans. She also raises poultry and works as a seamstress. She does it every day and has done it for 25 years. 

The loan she needs will allow her to buy agricultural materials she needs, such as: fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, concentrate, and more. This investment will allow her to obtain agricultural  materials and feed for the animals. Her dream is to acquire more animals and obtain more profits with this year's harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, concentrate and more.

loans.name: Bahriya

texts.ru: Бахрия добрая и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 48 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Бахрия проживает в городе Вахдат и работает там учительницей в средней школе. Она очень хорошая учительница и любит школу и своих учеников. Однако зарплата, которую получает Бахрия не хватает на семейные расходы. Сейчас Бахрия собирается начать собственный бизнес и совмещать его со своей преподавательской работой. Она имеет умение и навыки шитья женских национальных платьев. Бахрия запрашивает кредит для приобретения компьютерной швейной машины и тканей для шитья с целью открытия швейного бизнеса. Она будет заниматься этим у себя дома и уже отвела специальное место для деятельности. Бахрия планирует за день вышивать по два платья. По ее словам ее первыми клиентами будут ее родственники, соседи и знакомые. Она ждет вашу помощь.
texts.en: Bakhria is a kind, hardworking woman of 48 who is married and has children. She lives in city of Vakhdat, where she works as a middle school teacher. She is a very good teacher, and loves both the school and its students. But her salary is not enough to cover her family's expenses. Now Bakhria is planning on starting her own business and combine it with her teaching job. She has both the knowledge and skill for making women's traditional Tajik dresses. She is requesting a loan to purchase a computerized sewing machine and fabric so she can open up a tailoring business. She is going to work at home and has already set aside an area just for dressmaking. She is planning on embroidering two dresses per day. Her first customers will be her parents, neighbors, and friends. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine and fabric so she can open up a tailoring business

loans.name: El Diamante Group

texts.es: Está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Mercedes mujer de 22 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 2 y 4 años. Su negocio es la venta de pan desde hace 5 años vende sus productos ambulante y en su comunidad. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como harina, azúcar, manteca, mantequilla, levadura, queso, etc. Claudina mujer de 53 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de tortillas y frijoles y Dalila tiene 36 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de repostería
texts.en:
The group has three enterprising members, one of whom is Mercedes, who is married with two children aged 2 and 4.  She has sold bread for 5 years on the street and within her community.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, lard, butter, yeast, cheese etc.  

Claudina is a woman of 53 who sells tortillas and beans and 36-year-old  Dalila sells confectionary.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, lard, butter, yeast, cheese etc.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.ru: Вали позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Вали домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама. Сам Вали работает поваром в одном из  ресторанов посёлка. В этом ресторане он работает более 8 лет и получает хорошую заработную плату. Этого дохода хватает Вали только на проживание. Но у него есть мечта, Вали хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. И для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. Тех денежных средств, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Вали обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Вали надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку
texts.en: Vali is a cheerful and responsible man of 42 who is married and has three children. He lives with his family in a small village. But the house he lives in is too small and not very comfortable to live in. Vali's wife is a homemaker; she is a very hardworking and caring mother. Vali himself works as a waiter in a local restaurant. He has worked there for eight years and earns a decent salary. It is enough for Vali to get by, but that's all. But Vali dreams of building a large house for his family. He doesn't have the money for this; his salary isn't large enough to allow him to build a new house. So he has come to Arvand for a loan to buy building materials for the new house. He is hoping for a successful outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for its assistance.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: José Catalino

texts.es:
José tiene 56 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos; pero solo vive con su compañera de vida y una hija. Es agricultor y además aprendió la profesión de la albañilería la cual comenzó a trabajar en eso desde los 16 años de edad y lo cual hasta la fecha todavía desarrolla.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semilla, abono y fertilizantes, compra  4 metros de arena, 12 bolsas de cemento. 1 quintal de hierro, 1 libra de alambre de amarre 200 bloques que le faltan para terminar la construcción de una fosa séptica en su vivienda. 

Con el crédito será cubierta la necesidad de tener una mejor salud dentro de su vivienda con la construcción de la fosa séptica y la preparación de la tierra para el cultivo de los granos básicos que necesitan para su alimentación. Mejorando las condiciones de salud de la familia ya que con la construcción de la fosa séptica evitaran la salida de malos olores dentro de su vivienda y además con el cultivo podrán tener el maíz a la hora que necesiten y no tendrán que comprarlo, al contrario del pueden guardar para su alimentación y el resto lo pueden vender para obtener ingresos extras dentro del grupo familiar. 

Él es un hombre muy visionario, a futuro desea seguir mejorando su vivienda para que su familia pueda tener mejoras condiciones dentro del hogar.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old. He has a life-partner and 3 children but only lives with his partner and a daughter. He is a farmer and has also learned the trade of masonry which he began working in from the time he was 16 years old and which he still works in today.

The loan he is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy agricultural supplies such as seed, manure and fertilizer, 4 [cubic] meters of sand, 12 bags of cement, 1 quintal of iron, 1 pound of tie-down wiring, and 200 blocks which he needs to finish construction of a septic tank for his home.

The loan will help him provide for better household health through the construction of the septic tank and by preparing the land for the cultivation of basic grains they need for food. 

Health conditions will be improved for the family since the construction of the septic tank will eliminate bad odors in the home and also the harvest will provide corn right when they need it so they won’t have to buy it, instead they can save some to eat and sell the rest to earn extra income for the household.

He is a visionary and in the future hopes to continue improving his home so that his family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure and fertilizer, 4 [cubic] meters of sand, 12 bags of cement, 1 quintal of iron, 1 pound of tie-down wiring, and 200 blocks which he needs to finish construction of a septic tank for his home

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia, de 48 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Víctor y sus 7 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia. La zona donde se ubica es propicia para el crecimiento de zapallo, es por eso que es esta temporada desea invertir su esfuerzo y dinero en la siembra de varias hectáreas de terreno agrícola. Su buen juicio en la agricultura lo heredó de sus padres quienes como ella eran buenos agricultores, “nací y crecí con el campo, se mucho sobre la siembra y temporadas”, comenta. Cuando formó su familia decidió dedicarse a la actividad económica que aprendió toda su vida, la agricultura, ya son 20 años de experiencia en la siembra y comercialización de los mismos, cuenta que tiene clientes fijos quienes compran sus sembríos antes de la cosecha, su especialidad es el maíz, la papa y zapallo, además de criar animales entre cerdos, vacas, gallinas que le ayudan a obtener un dinero extra y constante para el hogar. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente feliz por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Herminia, invertirá los S/. 2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en: Herminia is a 48 years old. She is a humble woman. She lives with her husband Víctor and their 7 children whom she cares for with much love in her own home. The area where she lives is suitable for growing squash. That is why this season she wants to invest her efforts and money in planting several hectares of farmland. She inherited her good judgment for farming from her parents, who like her were good farmers. “I was born and I grew up in the country, I know a lot about planting and seasons" she says. When she started her family, she decided to work in the activity she had learned her whole life, farming. She has 20 years experience growing and selling. She says that she has regular customers who buy her crops before harvest. Her specialties are corn, potatoes, and squash, as well as raising animals like pigs, cows and chickens that help her obtain extra money and support her home. This is her second Kiva loan and she is happy with the financial support that she is getting to keep going ahead.  She is also committed to making her payments on time. Herminia will invest S/. 2500 soles in buying organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Dieudonné

texts.fr: Dieudonné est âgé de 45 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Chimène. Dieudonné a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Dieudonné n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Dieudonné vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les divers besoins du ménage. Dieudonné est un mécanicien. En dehors de son métier, Dieudonné fait la culture du manioc de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa famille. Dieudonné exerce cette activité depuis une quinzaine d'année. Dieudonné s’approvisionne en pièces de rechange dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Dieudonné sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Dieudonné, age 45, is married to a merchant named Chimène. He has five children, some of whom go to school. Dieudonné himself never attended school. He lives with his wife and their children, and the couple handle the household responsibilities together.  

Dieudonné is a car mechanic. As a secondary occupation, he is also a cassava farmer, which helps him to provide for the needs of his family. Dieudonné has been doing this for about 15 years. He buys his stock of spare parts locally. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase his sales and revenue, Dieudonné is seeking a 4th loan from ALIDé. This credit will allow him to bolster his activity, to expand his customer base and to increase his income. All three past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Octavio Josue

texts.es: Octavio, tiene 21 años, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.  Desde varios años se dedica a la venta de cacahuates, el compra el producto al por mayor y lo envasa en bolsas para vender. También elabora y vende pirulines (es un dulce hecho de azúcar, agua, color, sabores) este producto lo vende en la comunidad. Este préstamo que ha solicitado es el primero, el cual es por 15,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar los insumos como cacahuates, azúcar, colorantes bolsas etc. Para surtir el negocio y mejorar su condición económica. Su sueño es llegar a tener una  bodega y varios puestos de negocio.
texts.en:
Octavio is 21 years old, He is married, has 2 children, and lives with his wife and children in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. 

He has been selling peanuts for many years. He buys them at wholesale and puts them in bags to sell. He also makes pirulines (sweets made from sugar, water, color, and flavoring) and sells them in the community.

This is the first time he has applied for a loan, which is for 15,000 lempiras. He will use it to buy supplies such as peanuts, sugar, food  coloring, bags, and more.

The loan is to supply his business and improve his financial condition. His dream is to have a warehouse and several business stands.

loans.use: Comprar los insumos como cacahuates, azúcar, colorantes bolsas etc. para su negocio.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Tho is 54 years old. She has two children who have got married and are teachers. Her husband is a staff person working for a commune. His salary is about 3,000,000 VND per month. Tho grows rice and breeds chickens to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 30 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to invest in her chicken breeding. Her dream is to build a more spacious house. This loan is one of steps that helps her reach this dream. She can buy more chicken-feed and chicken breeds. Tho is a hardworking and dynamic woman.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more feed for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy more feed for chickens.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh was born in 1964. She has two children who have got married. She is a widow. She sews gloves and makes votive objects to earn a living. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for three years. Besides that, Hanh also grows rice to earn more money. Her family’s total income is about 14,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is lacking of capital to invest in her business. Her dream is having more capital to complete her house. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach her dream. She can buy more goods to sew gloves, to gain earnings and save profit for her dream. Hanh is a hardworking and careful woman. 

She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2004. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy more materials to sew gloves.

Other members who are part of Hanh’s group include the following:
 
Nu is 41 years old. She has two children. She is a building helper and raises chickens. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy more chickens to raise and she does sewing.

Khanh is 52 years old. She has two children. She raises chickens and pigs. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to invest in her breeding.

Canh is 53 years old. She has four children. She is a building helper and raises chickens. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy more chickens and pigs to raise.
 
Huong is 36 years old. She has three children. She sews gloves. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise chickens.

Dung is 24 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens.

Huong is 29 years old. She has three children. She catches fish and shrimp. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy fishing nets.

Lieu is 39 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise pigs.

loans.use: to buy more materials to sew gloves.

loans.name: Khuriniso

texts.ru: Хуринисо 40 лет. У нее есть муж и трое детей, с которыми она проживает в городе Дангара. Ее старший сын студент, второй сын учится в школе, а дочь еще маленькая. Хуринисо вместе с мужем работают усердно, чтобы обеспечивать семью и дать своим детям образование. Ее муж занимается продажей стройматериалов. Сама Хуринисо занимается торговлей тканей в течение 10 лет. Она имеет собственную торговую точку, где продает различные виды тканей для шитья женских национальных платьев. Хуринисо имеет богатый опыт в сфере торговли и обслуживает своих клиентов качественно. Ей сейчас необходимо увеличить товарооборот. Она просит кредит для закупа разнообразного ассортимента тканей на продажу.
texts.en: Kuriniso is 40, and lives with her husband and three children in Dangara. Her oldest son is a student, her other son is in elementary school, and her daughter is still very young. Kuriniso and her husband work diligently to support their family and provide for their children's education. Her husband sells construction materials; Kuriniso herself has been selling fabric for 10 years. She has her own retail space where she sells all kinds of fabrics for making women's traditional Tajik dresses. Kuriniso has a lot of experience in retail and serves her customers well. Now she needs to increase her sales. She is asking for a loan to buy a broad assortment of fabrics for sale.

loans.use: to buy a broad assortment of fabrics to increase her sales

loans.name: Taloa

texts.en:
Taloa is a 44-year-old married woman with nine children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Taloa has requested a loan to buy chemical for seven days, a backpack sprayer, bush knives, files and to pay for labour.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Taloa hopes to provide her family's everyday needs and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for seven days, a backpack sprayer, bush knives, files and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Valasi

texts.en:
Valasi is a 35-year-old woman who is married with two children. She has a small business of a taro and banana plantation. She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. 

Valasi will use the loan to buy cement, timber, iron roofing and nails. She will also use part of her loan to buy chemicals and a backpack sprayer.

Valasi joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, cement, timber, iron roofing and nails.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 43 años ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, refrescos, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus hijos, el negocio lo tiene  ubicado en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old. She has a store where she sells staples such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, candy, soft drinks, and other items. She has been in business many years and this has given her sales experience allowing her the best earnings. She lives in the home of a family member with her husband and children.

The business is located in the home where she is living in a busy locality and is well known by the locals. She has many customers as she has a well stocked store.

She wants to expand the business and make a new investment but she needs capital so she is requesting a loan in order to buy what she needs for the store. She is sure that she can pay off the loan and at the same time confident that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, sweets, soft drinks, and more items.

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es: Doña Marta de 56 años de edad vive en casa alquilada junto a sus dos hijos y su nieta, ella se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y los precios accesibles, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo y la ayuda de uno de sus hijos logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Marta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, encajes, adornos, forros, elásticos, botones, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marta, who is 56, lives in a rented house with her two children and her granddaughter.  She has made items of clothing for a number of years and has a large clientele on account of the quality of her work and her affordable prices.  She runs her business from her home and, with her earnings and the help of one of her children, she manages to cover the household expenses.  Marta is seeking a loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, lace, trimmings, linings, elastic, buttons etc. which will enable her to continue her work, make better profits and thereby provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, lace, linings, elastic, buttons etc.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 53 years old. She has two children who have got married. Her husband works as a driver to earn a living.  He earns about 5,000,000 VND. Thanh grows rice and breeds poultry. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 30 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of knowledge of breeding technology. Therefore her ducks and chickens get diseases easily and the output prices for them are cheap. Her dream is having a full life. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She can buy more breeding feed for her farm and expand her breeding. 

Thanh is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She does this job because she wants to supply more products for the good of society. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more breeding feed for her farm of chickens and ducks.

loans.use: to buy more breeding feed for her farm of chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Mahutin 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN 2 est formé de cinq personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie Kottin est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la septième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie Kottin est âgée de 60 ans et est mariée à un certain Idelphonse. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Marie Kottin et son mari supportent ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Marie Kottin n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a plus de dix ans que Marie Kottin mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois et de vin de palme à son domicile. Marie Kottin s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Marie Kottin n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Marie Kottin et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN 2 sollicitent ensemble un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHUTIN 2 group comprises five members who are friends living in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative, Marie Kottin, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  It is the seventh time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise its level of activity.

Marie Kottin is 60 years old and married to a man named Idelphonse.  They have one chid who goes to school.  Marie Kottin and her husband jointly take care of the household's expenses.

Marie Kottin did not go to school.  She has been selling charcoal and palm wine from her home, for more than ten years.  She buys her supplies in a town in Benin.

As the demand from her customers is increasing, and given her limited means, she can no longer satisfy all her customers' needs.   In view of this, and because of their limited resources, Marie Kottin and the other members of the MAHUTIN 2 group are requesting a collective loan from ALIDé.  Previous loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and palm wine.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Angeles works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Angeles is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and married with seven children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, etc.

Helen has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Helen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 53 years old. She has two children who have their own families. Her husband sells rice milling machines. His income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. Thuy grows rice and breeds pigs to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 30 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lack of knowledge of breeding technology, therefore her pigs  get diseases easily. Her dream is having a spacious house. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She can expand her breeding farm to gain earnings and save profit for her dream. 

Thuy is a hardworking woman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy pigs to breed to expand her breeding farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed to expand her breeding farm.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Juliana works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Juliana is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, noodles, eggs, etc., for her general store business.

Juliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell for her business.

Dionesia has been in this business for 10 years. Dionesia earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Dionesia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Seela

texts.en: Seela is a 52-year-old woman who is married with nine children. She has a small business in her plantation and vegetable garden. She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Seela will use the loan to buy timber, iron roofing and nails. She will also use part of her loan to buy a backpack sprayer and chemicals. Seela joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, timber, iron roofing and nails.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Kampala, Uganda and is widowed with five children;  two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market on a wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last five years. She works six days a week. Her other source of income is from rental houses.

Margret has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To  buy bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Group

texts.en:
Saraswati is a married woman of 39 years who lives at Muniguda under the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing at the left with raised hand is Saraswati. 

Her family comprises her husband and three daughters, age 24, 22 and 20. She is very energetic and hardworking and always devotes her time for the betterment of her family. 
 
Saraswati’s husband has had a small salon for the last 15 years to maintain the family. Now she has started her own beauty parlor. She has already availed three loans from Mahashakti. This time she needs a loan for expanding her salon and parlor by purchasing a moving chair and facial and face-message items.

She has an ambition to establish an AC salon at Muniguda.

Another member of her group, Bijaylaxmi, needs a loan to invest in her husband’s salon.

loans.use: to purchase a moving chair and facial and face-message items.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is a 50-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business of her taro and banana plantation. To earn extra income, she also has an ice-cake business. Kalala needs a loan to buy taro root crop, chemicals, a spade, a pickaxe, fertilizer, plastic bags, cordial, sugar and a deep freezer. She will use her profits to help her family and her children's education. Kalala joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy taro root crop, chemicals, a spade, a pickaxe, fertilizer, plastic bags, cordial, sugar and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Rosa Delmy

texts.es: rosa de 38 años de edad vive con sus tres hijos de 13, 15, y 18 años de edad en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortas y papas fritas,  lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esa actividad,  tiene mucha clientela ya que es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de todos los ingredientes necesarios como: panes para tortas, carne, pollos, papas, mayonesa, curtido, salsa de tomate, utensilios desechables, etc. para seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old. She lives in her own home with her 3 children who are 13, 15 and 18 years old.

She sells sandwiches and french fries on foot in various suburbs near her place of residence. She has been working in this field for 3 years and has many customers as she is a very friendly and hardworking person. She has been able to meet some of the household expenses with her earnings.

Rosa is asking for a loan to buy necessary ingredients such as bread for sandwiches, meat, chicken, potatoes, mayonnaise, cole slaw, tomato sauce, disposable utensils, etc. in order to continue in her business and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bread for sandwiches, meat, chicken, potatoes, mayonnaise, cole slaw, tomato sauce, disposable utensils, etc.

loans.name: Maa Manikeswari Group

texts.en:
Surekha lives in the small town of Bhawanipatna, the district headquarters of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. She is a headstrong and confident lady. She hails from a poor family below the poverty line. The lady seated in the middle with a raised hand is Surekha. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters and one son. 

Surekha has been doing vegetable vending for the last 10 years with the active support of her husband. Surekha gets a monthly income of INR 5,000 from the above business. Out of this income, she is hardly able to manage her household expenses. 

In the year 2010, Surekha, along with four other women, formed a group named Maa Manikeswari to avail loans from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their businesses. She needs financial support from Mahashakti to purchase more vegetables and fruits and hire a stall from the municipality. This will be her third loan.

In future, she wants to be a vegetable wholesaler in her locality.

The other four members of the group are Fula, Dalimba, Rebati and Sebati. They need loans for a footwear business, a tyre resoling business, a footwear business and a vegetable vending business, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits and to rent a stall.

loans.name: Reccy

texts.en: Reccy is married and has six children. She lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him manage the farm they own to earn a living. She has been doing this kind of business for more than 20 years. In 2012, she joined GDMPC and it has helped her to improve her ability to engage in business. She planned to replant bananas to expand her farm. In order to cover the cost of replanting and to buy fertilizers, such as manure, she requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from GDMPC. She hopes with this their living conditions will be better in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of replanting and to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is married and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer, and she helps him in managing their farm. In order to cover the costs of banana replanting and weeding maintenance, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit, which she had joined last year. She hopes to gain more harvest in order to send her children to school and be able to provide for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of banana replanting and weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, with her family. She has three children who need her support morally and financially. Her husband is a fisherman, and she helps him by buying nipa leaves and weaving them for sale in town. She has been doing this for 15 years. 

In 2012, she joined GDMPC, and she is currently requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional nipa leaves. She will be able to weave more in order to gain more income for the better living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa leaves to weave.

loans.name: Gbemiga Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEMIGA est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Edwige est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Edwige est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un peintre du nom de Roger. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés. Edwige n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Edwige assure ensemble avec son mari les divers besoins du ménage. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Edwige mène comme activité la vente de liqueurs, des mèches et divers autres articles dans une ville du Bénin. Edwige exerce cette activité depuis une vingtaine d'année. Edwige s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Edwige sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEMIGA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The GBEMIGA group consists of three friends who belong to the same savings group. Their representative is Edwige (with her hand raised in the photo). Edwige, age 38, is married to a painter named Roger, and they have six children, some of whom go to school. Edwige herself never went to school. She and her husband provide together for their household.  

To help support her family, Edwige has been selling miscellaneous items including soft drinks, hair extensions and other items in a city of Benin. She has been doing this for about 20 years, and she buys her stock in a city of Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, and to bolster her sales and revenue, Edwige is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of her group. This credit will help them to stock up on merchandise to sell and to expand their customer base.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, soft drinks, and various other items to sell.

loans.name: Maa Markama Group

texts.en:
Manjulata, age about 34 years, resides with her only son, age 17, at Muniguda in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a widow. The lady standing second from left with raised hand in the photograph is Manjulata. 

In the year 2009 she formed a group with three other members of her village to avail loans from Mahashakti Foundation.

Currently, Manjulata is making leaf plates and also collecting them from others for wholesaling. She earns about INR 7,000 per month from her business. According to Manjulata, this amount is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditures. So she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income.

She has already availed three loans from Mahashakti. This is her fourth. From the present loan, she wants to invest in purchasing more leaf plates to increase the turnover of her business. Manjulata has an ambition to install a leaf plate making machine in future and to educate her son for a bright career.

The other three members of the group, Sahida, Pratima and Jayanti, are doing a mobile repairing center, a leaf plates making and selling business and a hotel, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase more leaf plates for wholesaling.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es comerciante, su nivel de  educación es  técnico medio, vive en casa propia ocupando 3  habitaciones de acabado fino.
Maritza trabaja 8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, de educación de sus hijos y otros.
Lamentablemente Maritza vive en condiciones insalubres por el deterioro y malas condiciones del sistema de alcantarillado de su vivienda, mismo que ocasiona enfermedades y  gases tóxicos. Es por eso que necesita el crédito, para poder instalar un sistema de alcantarillado adecuado  que no sea un riesgo para su salud y además impida fugas de agua para poder ahorrar mejor este recurso natural y no cause un daño al medio ambiente.
El sueño de Maritza es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Maritza is a merchant, she has received a middle technical education and lives in her own 3-bedroom house with a good finishing. She works eight hours a day to cover the costs of food, electricity, water, her children's education and other costs. 

Unfortunately, Maritza lives in unsanitary conditions due to the deterioration and the poor sewage system in her home, which causes diseases and toxic gases. She is requesting this loan to be able to install an adequate sewage system, so it doesn't pose a health risk and it prevents leak, allowing her to save water and not cause environmental damage. 

Maritza's dream is that her children finish their college education.

loans.use: to install a sewage system

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose  se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) El vive con su esposa y sus hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Huyrocondo, del Sector Batallas de La provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.


Requiere crédito  para comprar alimento suplementario y mejorar la nutrición del ganado y mejorar la producción lechera por las siguientes características de la cascarilla de SOYA, es un subproducto del procesamiento industrial de soya y muy voluminoso.
Tiene un alto contenido de carbohidratos (75%) y azúcares solubles (2%).
En el altiplano existe déficit en la disponibilidad de proteína, principalmente en la época de estiaje (meses de junio a noviembre), razón por el cual es importante suplementar con cascarilla de soya como fuente de proteína para el ganado. También la compra de alimentos suplementarios se mitiga en la presión de ampliar más áreas de producción de forraje y hará descansar por una temporada otros terrenos.

El sueño de Jose, es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jose raise cattle to produce milk, which he sells to Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), a corporation. He lives with his wife and children in their own house in Huyrocondo, Batallas in Los Andes province in the department of La Paz, about three hours from the city of La Paz. He owns a number of high-quality cattle that require better care, given local weather conditions.

He needs a loan to buy supplementary feed, which improves his livestock's diet and milk production, that contains soy hull, which is a by-product of the industrial soy process and is very bulky, with the following characteristics: a high content of carbohydrates (75%) and soluble sugars (2%).
