This time she is applying for 1500 PEN, she is very happy to know that she will be receiving financial support that allows her to move forward, and she pledges to make her repayments on time. She will use the requested loan primarily to buy cosmetics such as talc, lotions, perfumes, and other toiletries.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as talc, lotions, perfumes, and other toiletries

loans.name: July

texts.es:
July tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive alado de su madre en su casa propia. July se dedica a la venta de pescado. Tiene su puesto de ventas que comparte con su madre que está ubicado en uno de los mercados. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano y se dirige al puerto para comprar al por mayor sus productos. Selecciona aquellas especies que tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes respetando siempre las etapas de veda. Compra por canastas al por mayor y los vende por kilos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 2 años aproximadamente y aprendió gracias a su mamá. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo por las tardes para descansar en su casa y realizar otras funciones, además siempre fue independiente y se acostumbró a valerse por sí misma, espera mantener el mismo ritmo laboral y continuar trabajando por mucho más tiempo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo para seguir desarrollando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como antes.
Con el monto solicitado comprará pescados de gran demanda entre sus clientes en mayor cantidad ya que en esta temporada el consumo de ciertas especies se incrementa.
texts.en:
July, age 21, is single.  She lives alongside her mother in her own house. July sells fish.  She has her sales stand, which she shares with her mother, at one of the markets.  She gets up early every day and heads to the port to buy her products wholesale.  She selects the types of fish that have the greatest demand among her customers.  She always respects regulations regarding the season during which each fish can be caught. She buys her fish wholesale by the basket and sells it by the kilogram.  She has been doing this work for approximately two years.  She learned thanks to her mother.

What she likes about her work is that she has time in the evenings to rest at home and to do other tasks.  Also, she was always independent, and she got used to standing on her own two feet.  She hopes to maintain the same work pace and to continue working for a lot more time.

She will now request 500 soles.  She is grateful to those who provide her with the loan in order to continue developing her business.  She is sure that she will continue to be a very punctual client, and she will make her payments on time as she has done before.

She will use the requested loan to buy fish that is in great demand by her customers.  She will buy in greater quantities because during this season consumption of certain types is increasing.

loans.use: to buy fish that is in great demand for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Las Rosas De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Las Rosas de San antonio es un Grupo nuevo, que con mucho entusiasmo esta trabajando para poder salir adelante. Son 17 mujeres con muchas ansias de crecer, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como medio para conocer la situación de cada una, de las cuales 3 están por debajo de la linea de pobreza, es decir, en nivel rojo con ingresos muy bajos.
Blanca es parte de este grupo, en su ultima encuesta estuvo en un nivel rojo, es decir, con ingresos básicos mínimos. Hoy ella esta trabajando el doble para mejorar su vida y la de su familia, y como medio de lucha se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser pantalones, remeras, camisas, capuchas, abrigos y demás. Ella y sus compañeras están felices por esta oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Rosas de San Antonio" is a new group which is working very enthusiastically to get ahead.  The 17 women members are excited to grow.  They are participating in a poverty elimination survey to determine each one's situation, and three of the members appear to be below the poverty line with very low incomes.

Blanca is one of the group members below the poverty line and she has a minimal basic income.  Nowadays she is working double time to improve her and her family's lifestyle.  She earns a living selling all kinds of clothing.

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of clothing, such as pants, shorts, shirts, hoodies, coats, etc.  Blanca and her colleagues are grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as pants, shorts, shirts, hoodies, coats and other items.

loans.name: Lkhagvajav

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvajav, 40 years old, lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He, together with a few of his friends, has recently began running a taxi service company. He has a position of internal auditor at a taxi company. His parents both have retired from work and now get a state pension. Currently he is building a brick house on his land to prepare for his upcoming marriage. The roofing and installing windows and door as well as interior decoration remain due to lack of finances. 

According to his own calculations, building a new house on his old home's foundation has several advantages: in winter time, the old house was losing all its heat through walls and windows and more space will be needed in the near future as he gets married and becomes a father. So he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass, shingles and foam for house building. The high quality new house will reduce the family's coal consumption greatly as Mongolians usually use coal for heating. Burning less coal will contribute to the efforts against air pollution as it will release less pollutant into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Ventanilla Alta 2 Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Ventanilla Alta
Margot de 27 años es la presidenta del grupo y lo conforman 07 socias. Margot es casada y tiene 02 hijos pequeños. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, empezó este negocio para  colaborar con los ingresos del hogar y ayudar a su esposo que es pintor, su trabajo es independiente y le permite acomodar sus tiempos sin descuidar a sus hijos. Margot tiene muchas clientas a quienes les ofrece ropa de buena calidad y les brinda facilidad de pago, en esta oportunidad el dinero de su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de invierno que sus clientas le han solicitado, mas adelante le gustaría alquilar un puesto en algún mercado para instalar su negocio de esa manera obtendría más ingresos. Margot es la que viste casaca deportiva color azul con blanca y pantalon jean.
* la foto pequeña pertenece a una de las socias Karla.
texts.en:
This is the “Ventanilla Alta” group.  Margot, 27, is group president and the group has 7 members.  Margot is married and has two small children.  She works selling clothes.  She started this business to help cover household expenses and help her husband who is a painter.  Her work is independent which allows her to manage her time so as not to neglect her children.

Margot has many customers that she sells quality clothes to and to whom she offers easy payment terms.  On this occasion she will use the money from her loan to buy winter clothes her customers have requested.  Later on she’d like to rent a stand in some market to set up her business in order to earn higher income this way.  Margot is wearing the blue and white sports jacket and jeans trousers.

The small picture is of one of the other borrowers, Karla.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 63 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. She also has had a farm for planting and harvesting rice for sale.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and cover labor costs . She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover labour costs

loans.name: Deutelina

texts.es: Deutelina de 43 años de edad vive con su hijo de 13 años, se dedica al negocio de confeccionar ropa; produciendo, blusas, pantalones, vestidos y faldas para mujeres. Vive en el popular municipio de Soledad del departamento del Atlántico, Costa Norte de Colombia. Su negocio lo inició desde el año 1996, es decir, hace 17 años. Su idea del negocio la estudió bien, y se dio cuenta que era productivo montar el taller de confecciones, que le daría buena rentabilidad, diseñar sus propias prendas de vestir, confeccionarlas y venderlas a la medida del gusto de los clientes. También fabrica prendas de vestir en cadena. Su mercado de  clientes está conformado principalmente por almacenes, y vecinos del sector donde vive. Comercializa sus productos ofreciéndolos a clientes reales y potenciales con mostrarios, es decir prendas que usa de modelos para que los clientes aprecien y se decidan a realizar sus pedidos. Su horario de trabajo es 7:30 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de hilos, telas, y una máquina plana, para mejorar el servicio y la calidad de las prendas confeccionadas. Sus metas son: Aumentar la clientela actual y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida, y la de su hijo.
texts.en: Deutelina, 43, lives with her 13-year-old son.  She works making clothes producing blouses, pants, dresses and skirts for women.  She lives in the popular municipality of Soledad in Atlántico Department, North Coast of Colombia.  She started her business in 1996, that is, 17 years ago.  She studied her business idea well and realized that setting up a sewing workshop would be productive; that designing, making and selling her clothes to customer order would be profitable.  She also mass produces clothes.  Her customer market consists mainly of stores and local neighbors.  She sells her products to actual and potential customers showing them samples, that is, items she uses as models so the customer can appreciate them and decide on what to order.  She works from 7:30am until 6pm.  This is her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy thread, fabric and a sewing machine to improve service and quality of items made.  Her goals are to: increase clientele and to continue improving her and her son’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer lives in Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanag del Sur where he provides a service-based business of motor transport in the community. He is married and has six children that need his support. In 2007, he became a member of GDMPC and recently, he borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair his existing motorcycle. He plans to buy a sidecar to improve his services.

loans.use: to repair his existing motorcycle

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Santa Ana es un grupo formado en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, tiene 16 integrantes, y ellas estan el el cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación Paraguaya. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una, donde 7 mujeres estan con ingresos muy bajos y luchando por salir adelante.
Una de ellas es Silvia, quien por medio de la venta de cosméticos, y su trabajo del día a día esta ayudando a su familia, es una persona que desde siempre trabajo y por medio de ese trabajo se abrió camino. Su sueño es poder llegar a ser un microempresaria independiente y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirla en la compra de cosméticos de distintas marcas, lo que también la ayudará a seguir con sus ventas y mejorando su linea de pobreza.
texts.en:
Santa Ana is a group that was formed in the city of  San Lorenzo. It has 16 members and they are in their fourth cycle of the program of the women's committee of the Fundación Paraguaya. They are doing the poverty elimination survey to know each of their situations, and 7 women have very low income and are fighting to get ahead. 

One of them is Silvia, who through selling cosmetics and working day to day is helping her family. She is a person who has always worked and through her work has made her way. Her dream is to be able to become an independent micro-businesswoman and keep helping her family. 

She is asking for this help to be able to invest it in buying different brands of cosmetics, which will also help her to keep making her sales and improving her conditions of poverty.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de  Itacurubí del Rosario, ciudad del Santaní, es una compañía alejada y con escasos medios de acceso. Es una comunidad en crecimiento y que lucha por mejorar.
La señora Elba, es una de las integrantes, ella cuenta con una Despensa en donde invierte todo lo que tiene, y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. Empezó con un pequeño negocio y poco a poco y gracias al esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo.
Solicita de este crédito ya que quiere surtir su negocio con los insumos de primera necesidad que es lo que mas llevan sus clientes, como ser leche, pan, carne, bebidas y verduras. Agradece por esta ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano” committee was formed when several neighbors got together in the community of Itacurubí del Rosario, city of Santaní. It is a remote community with few means of access. It is a community that is growing and fighting to improve.   

Elba is one of the members. She has a small store where she invests everything she has and in this way helps her family. She started with a small business and little by little, thanks to her hard work, is getting ahead. Her goal is to keep working and helping her family as she has done. 

She is asking for this loan because she wants to stock her business with staple products that her customers buy the most, such as milk, bread, meat, beverages and vegetables. She is grateful for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, meat, beverages, and vegetables

loans.name: Blacida

texts.es:
Blasida es estudiante de notariado en una de las universidades más prestigiosas del país, ella está casada y tiene un hijo, quien es su motivo de lucha y a quien quiere ayudar a tener un futuro digno.
Su meta es terminar su carrera y poder ejercer la profesión. Aspira a ser una profesional y desempeñarme como tal en esa área para poder ayudar dentro de la familia y lograr crecer con ella.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de la universidad, para que de esa forma siga estudiando y no tener que preocuparse. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Blasida is studying to become a notary at one of the country’s most prestigious universities.  She’s married and has a son who is the motivator for her to strive and who she wants to help have a proper future. 

Her goal is to finish her career and be able to practice her profession.  She relates that she hopes to become a professional and develop as such in that area to be able to help within the family and manage to grow with it.

She requests this loan to pay university tuition fees so that she can continue studying worry-free.  She’s very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
San Isidro se forma con la esperanza de que todas las integrantes puedan ayudar a sus familias. Este grupo esta en su ciclo sexto. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder superar sus limitaciones e ir creciendo, y mejorar la pobreza de todas.
Una de estas mujeres y ejemplo de trabajo es Irene, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles. Ella cuenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela, ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y sus clientes siempre le piden. Cuenta también que al principio le costo abrirse camino, pero que después poco a poco fue creciendo.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder comprar carne, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder segur haciendo sus alimentos y seguir creciendo día a día.
texts.en:
San Isidro communal bank was formed with the hope that all the members would be able to help their families.  The group is in its sixth funding cycle.  The woman are heads of their households and are doing the poverty elimination survey to help overcome their limitations, to keep growing and to improve all of their levels of poverty. 
One of these women, and an example of the work they do, is Irene.  She makes her living selling food.  She says that she has a very good clientele, as the food she makes is quite delicious and much requested.  She also says that at the beginning, it was hard to break into the business.  But the business soon started growing, little by little. 
Today Irene is requesting the loan in order to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments and other supplies for making the food she sells.  It will also help her business to grow each day.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old and married with three children.

She has a small garden where she grows taro, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Maria needs a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, backpack sprayer, pickaxe, wheelbarrow, spade, and file for her business.

Maria has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family and her childrens' educations.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, backpack sprayer, pick axe, wheelbarrow, spade, and file.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Victoria  está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de CONCEPCION, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Angelina es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona muy alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de reciclaje, la cual  sale también a vender en otros lugares sus productos, en un carrito de reciclaje. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ingredientes para poder hacer también alimentos y poder venderlos y tener un ingreso extra. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The La Victoria group is in its third cycle of the women’s committee program in the city of Concepción.  This is an area a bit away from the central zone, and it is still growing.  The area is difficult to access.  That is why the members of this group want to carry on in order to grow and to give the area where they live a better environment.  They want to continue slowly growing.

Angelina is one of the members.  She is from an area that is very far from the center of the city where she has her small business of selling recyclables.  She also goes out to sell her products in other places in a cart with recyclables.  She wishes that, as time passes, and with the help of the people in her area, they will improve their environment and provide their families with greater security and a better future.

She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients in order to be able to also make food and be able to sell it and have an extra income.   This way she will be able to continue growing with her business.  She will also be able to give her family what they need in order to have a life without deprivations.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, salt, and others in order to make food.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es:
La Señora Clemencia tiene una despensa hace mas de 10 años, es una cliente excelente que gracias a la ayuda que le brinda la fundación paraguaya pudo ir creciendo en su negocio con la cual mantiene a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Su perimer crédito de Kiva lo utilizó en la compra de insumos para su despensa, hoy solicita de nuevo otro crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, verduras, arroz, azúcar, fideos, y demás productos de primera necesidad para seguir trabajando. Agradece esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Clemencia has had a grocery store for more than 10 years. She is an excellent client who has been able to continue growing her business thanks to the help which the Fundación Paraguaya gives her. Thus she is able to look after her family and gives them everything they need so they do not suffer any hardship. She used her first Kiva loan to buy supplies for her grocery store. Today she is asking for another loan to be able to buy fruit, vegetables, rice, sugar, noodles and other grocery essentials so she can continue working. She is grateful for the new opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, rice, sugar, noodles and other products.

loans.name: Rosario Paulina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos  de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y una niña que es hija de crianza de 6 años que estudia en escuela y es la única que aún vive con ella. Su esposo es artesano.

Doña Rosario tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí  además de víveres también vende frutas, legumbres, artículos de papelería y de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde la madrugada ya que a esa hora llegan sus clientes a comprar productos para el consumo del día, ella a ciertos clientes de confianza les deja a crédito hasta la quincena o fin de mes que ellos cobran, con esto  gana más clientela y sus ventas cada vez mejoran mas, tiene más de 5 años con su negocio el cual le deja muy buenas satisfacciones ya que allí ella se gana algo sin salir de su casa.

Este crédito es para surtir aún más su tienda y su papelería, va a comprar víveres y útiles escolares. Lleva 5 ciclos en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que le brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Guillermo Balda community bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally known crafts.  It is also the place where the famous Panama hats are from.

Rosario is 41 years old, married, and has three children.  Two of them are adults and her youngest daughter is 6 years old, goes to school, and is the only one who lives with her.  Her husband is an artisan.

Rosario has a small general store in her home where she sells food items as well as fruits, legumes, stationary products, and housewares.  She works every day starting at dawn, since that is the time her customers come to buy products to consume that day.  She gives credit to certain trusted customers until the 15th or end of the month.  This earns her more customers and her sales always improve.  She has had this business for more than five years and she is very satisfied with it since she is able to earn money without leaving home.

She is requesting this loan to increase stock in her store, so she will purchase food items and school supplies.  This is her fifth loan with the community bank and she likes it for the benefits and help that the institution provides.  

Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his inventory of pants to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of fruit & vegetables.

loans.name: Sanya Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SANYA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NERIKO, un des villages de la Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec MINATA MAMA  2ème debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  KOLONDIEBA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "SANYA II" are married women, who average 35 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in NERIKO, a village in the Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaboring with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with MINATA MAMA, who is standing second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in KOLONDIEBA . She plans on making a profit of 145,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing for the planting season

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de jóvenes es de la ciudad de Luque Son 5 jóvenes que se unieron con el objetivo de poder empezar a trabajar y salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias. Ellos están muy entusiasmados ya que podrán ayudar con los ingresos de la casa, y de esa forma poder sentirse útiles.
Uno de estos jóvenes es Ariel, quien tiene 16 años, cuenta que está trabajando en cocinar pollos y asados para distinto tipo de eventos en los que ayuda a su abuelo. El es un joven de muy buena familia, todos son muy trabajadores, y quiere poder seguir el ejemplo que sus papas le dieron, y de esa forma poder ayudarles y que se sientan orgullosos de él.
Pide de este crédito para la compra de libros para sus estudios, lo que le ayudara para poder seguir creciendo y educándose.
En la foto del grupo aparecen mas personas ya que en el mismo estan los jóvenes con sus padres, quienes son sus codeudores que también firman en el contrato.
texts.en:
This group of young people is from the city of Luque. These five young people have joined together so that they can begin working and moving forward in order to help their families. They are very excited about being able to help with the household income since this will make them feel useful.

One of these young individuals is Ariel. He is 16 years old and has a job preparing roasted chickens for different events with the help of his grandfather. This young man is from a very good family in which everyone works hard. Ariel continues to follow the example that his parents have set for him, which allows him to be helpful. His parents are very proud of him.

Ariel is requesting a loan so that he can buy books for his studies. This will help him to continue growing and learning.

In the photo, the additional people are the parents of the young people. They are also cosigners of the loan contract.

loans.use: to buy books and school supplies.

loans.name: Nestor Ivan

texts.es:
Nestor  tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Nestor  se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de maíz y soya. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes, semillas, insecticidas. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder aumentar los cultvos.

El sueño es tener más terrenos para logran incrementar los sembrios. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Nestor is 22 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

He is a member of the Cevallos communal bank, which is located in the San Francisco district, which is part of the San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish, and is dedicated to agricultural work.

Nestor works in agriculture, planting corn and soy beans. He is applying for the loan to be able to buy fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. The loan will be a great help to him to be able to increase his plantings.

His dream is to have more land to be able to increase his plantings. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Sanya Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SANYA III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NERIKO, un des villages de la Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  FANTA 1ère assise à droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1.5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et  au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 115.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "SANYA III" are married women, who average 36 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in NERIKO, a village in the Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaboring with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with FANTA, who is the first person sitting at the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 1.5 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the market to men and women customers. She plans on making a profit of 115,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing during the planting season

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул, 57 лет, замужем, мать-героиня, имеет 6 детей (3 дочери и 3 сына). По специальности швея. С 1989 по 2012 годы работала социальным работником в соцфонде. С 1990 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 12 000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 10000  сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 3 дойные коровы, 10 овец, 1 лошадь. Также в наличии имеет 4,48 ГА поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно сажает клевер и фасоль. Супруг и дети помогают Айнагул по хозяйству. Прибыль позволила Айнагул размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнагул обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30 000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем хочет сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 57 years old, married, and the mother-heroine of six children (three daughters and three sons). By profession, she is a seamstress. From 1989 to 2012, she worked as a social worker in a social fund. 

Since 1990, she has been involved in agriculture--raising livestock and farming--starting this business with a sum of 12,000 som (KGS). Monthly income from the loan is 10,000 som (KGS). Through hard work, Ainagul today has a good homestead: three dairy cows, ten sheep, and one horse. She also has available 4.48 hectares of irrigated land, on which annually she plants clover and beans. Ainagul's spouse and children help her on the farm. 

Profits allowed Ainagul to propagate her livestock on the homestead and thus to improve the family's well-being. With the goal of further developing her business, Ainagul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase mineral fertilizers to prepare the land. 

Ainagul plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the count of livestock, and in this way in the future wants to do home repairs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Angel Gualberto

texts.es:
Angel tiene 34 años es soltero no tiene hijos, vive solo en un departamento arrendado en San Jose de Chimbo, Provincia de Bolivar.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y trigo eL dinero lo solicita para la comprar de fertilizantes, Herbicidas, insecticidas. Con el credito ha podido comprar lo necesario para la simbra.

El sueño es tener dinero para comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Angel, who is 34, is single and  has no children  He lives alone in a rented apartment in San José de Chimbo, in Bolivar province.  

Angel is a farmer who grows corn and wheat.  He is applying for the loan to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides.  The loan has enabled him to buy what he needs for sowing.  

His dream is to have the money to buy land to carry on growing his crops.

In his free time, he likes playing indoor football.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides

loans.name: William De Jesús

texts.es: William es un hombre de 35 años de edad, su familia está conformada por su esposa y un hijo de 9 años. Él siempre ha vivido en el campo, por lo que actualmente se dedica a diversas actividades comerciales y agropecuarias, pues tiene cultivos de maíz, terneras, gallinas ponedoras, un lago con peces como truchas y tilapias, adicionalmente vende mercancía puerta a puerta, compra y vende oro y cobre. El prestatario es luchador y muy emprendedor, su situación ha sido muy difícil desde el año 2008, cuando perdió su mano derecha en un accidente laboral, pero la empresa nunca se encargó de los gastos de las cirugías, por lo que le tocó asumir esos gastos y demandar a la empresa. William ya ha tenido 5 ciclos de créditos con la Corporación y con el que solicita actualmente lo invertirá en la compra de alevinos (crías de peces), comida para peces y ampliación del lago, con el fin de poder incrementar sus ventas. Su principal sueño es poder tener una casa propia y brindar una estabilidad económica a su familia, por lo que trabaja arduamente para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
William’s a 35-year-old man; his family consists of his wife and a 9-year-old son.  He’s always lived in the countryside and he currently works in various commercial, agricultural and animal husbandry activities because he grows corn, raises calves and laying hens and has a lake with fish like trout and tilapia.  He also sells merchandise door to door and buys and sells gold and copper.  The borrower is hardworking and enterprising.  His situation has been very difficult since 2008 when he lost his right hand in a work accident but the firm never took care of the cost of his surgeries so he had to assume those costs and to sue the firm.

William has had five loan cycles with the Corporation and the one he’s asking for now will be used to buy fish fry, fish food and to enlarge the lake so that sales will increase.  His main dream is to own a house and provide economic stability for his family which is why he works hard to improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish fry, fish food and to enlarge the lake.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: Magda es una mujer casada, trabajadora, y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y su hijo. Magda se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y refrescos de frutas orgánicas, y desde su casa atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes ganándose sus preferencias. Se siente una persona productiva y apoya a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Espera en un futuro abrir otro negocio de venta de productos comestibles, acondicionando una tienda en su casa, para así poder estar cerca de su hijo y brindarle los cuidados que necesita. Esto es el segundo préstamo con Kiva. Está contenta de saber que tendrá una ayuda financiera para avanzar con su negocio. Por consiguiente, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará bebidas gaseosas de diversos sabores y marcas así tener un stock variado.
texts.en:
Magda’s a hardworking married woman living in her own house with her husband and son.  Magda works selling soft-drinks and organic fruit beverages from home; she takes care of her customers there very kindly winning over their patronage.  She feels like a productive person able to help her spouse with household expenses.  She hopes in future to open another business setting up a grocery store at home to sell food items so she can be close to her son providing him with the care they need.

This is her second Kiva loan.  She’s happy to know that she’ll have financial help to make business progress.  Therefore, she commits to make her payments like she’s done with previous loans.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to buy carbonated soft-drinks in assorted flavors and brands to have varied stock on-hand.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo  Santa Librada está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, las integrantes se unieron con el proposito de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del grupo. Son luchadoras y por sobre todo muy emprendedoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Ella es costurera y tiene un pequeño taller, el cual es el medio de ingresos que tiene para su familia.
La Sra. Maria  solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas e insumos para la confección, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The Santa Librada group is in its fourth cycle of the women's committee. The members got together with the aim of helping their families via the group. They are determined and above all very enterprising. One of the members is Maria who is improving her own and her family's life by hard work and continuous effort and by demonstrating the essential characteristics of a successful woman. She is a seamstress and has a small workshop, which is  her source of income for her family. Maria is asking for this loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies, which will help her to set up her business plan. This will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy material and sewing supplies

loans.name: Iderbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Iderbaatar is a 34-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, which is the second largest city of Mongolia.  The family resides in a house on fenced land.  He has been working as a welder at a steel mill for thirteen years since his university graduation. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase barbecue accessories and cooking equipment in order to make and sell barbecue during national holidays.  By doing so, he can generate more income for his family and invest in his children's education.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants his children to be well educated.

loans.use: to purchase barbecue accessories and cooking equipment.

loans.name: Sanya I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SANYA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NERIKO, un des villages de la Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec FATOUMATA LAMINE 1ère debout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "SANYA I" are married women, who average 33 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in NERIKO, a village in the Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaboring with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with FATOUMATA LAMINE, who is standing first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and at the market . She plans on making a profit of 95,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing for the planting season

loans.name: Sonia Cecibel Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia vive en casa de un familiar con sus tres hijos y su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar. Sonia esta solicitando un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in a family home with her three children and her mother.  She has made a living selling tortillas out of her house.  For many years, she has worked Monday through Sunday and has many customers.  She is a hardworker and friendly.  The earnings that she obtains will be used to resolve the current costs of her home.
Sonia is asking for a loan to buy corn by the kilogram and lime powder in order to continue making tortillas and to obtain better earnings so that her family has better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer in Kangundo town where he plants beans, potatoes, tomatoes, and maize.  He is 41 years old, married, and has three children.  He has been in this business for the last four years.

This being his first loan term, he plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting.  He will also buy a water pump for pumping water in his farm.  He hopes to expand his business by planting more cash crops, hence making more income, and being able to cater to the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es: Rosenda tiene 67 años, está divorciada y vive en su casa propia junto y 2 de sus 4 hijos. Rosenda se dedica al  transporte de pasajeros para lo cual cuenta con un vehículo de segundo uso  que luego el vehículo lo alquila a una persona responsable quien le paga de firma diaria. Lleva en el negocio del transporte más de 08 años y solo cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo. Le gusta su actividad ya que puede manejar sus tiempos pus en la mañana trabaja como docente comenta se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener los ingresos económicos adicionales, ahora se siente más tranquila y cómoda ya que tiene un ingreso permanente y cuenta con más tiempo libre. Esto será préstamo número 15 con Kiva.  Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por tanto, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles, tiene planes de invertir en mantenimiento de su vehículo. Además de la compra de repuestos como llantas y otros, para así tener operativo su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosenda is 67 years old and divorced.  She lives in her own house with two of her four children.  Rosenda is in the passenger transportation business.  She has a second hand vehicle that she rents out to a responsible person who pays her a daily fixed rate.

She has been in the transportation business for over eight years.  She only has her children’s help in performing maintenance on her vehicle.  She likes her business activity because she is able to manage her time.  In the morning she works as a teacher.  She says that she decided on this business activity out of the need to have additional income.  She now feels calm and comfortable because she has a permanent income, and she has more free time.

This will be her fifteenth Kiva loan.  She is counting on your collaboration in order to be able to firm up her plans.  She pledges to make her payments like she has done with the previous loans.  She will use the 1,000 soles for maintenance of her vehicle.  She will also buy replacement parts like tires and other things.  She will do this in order to have her work tool operational.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts like tires and other things to fix her vehicle.

loans.name: Orgoi

texts.en:
Mr. Orgoi is a 63-year-old man who lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been extracting and selling spar for eleven years.  His wife is an inspector who checks apartment heating and sanitation.  His daughter goes to high school.  The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and is in need of serious repair. 

For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 3,800,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam.  Using these materials, he can repair and insulate his old house in order to make it a more comfortable and warm.  The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and release less pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Carlos Andrés

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 24 años de edad, aún no tiene hijos y es soltero. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como cocinero en un restaurante y con esto ha obtenido dinero para apoyar la carga económica en su casa. 
“Quiero capacitarme para mejorar a nivel profesional y así conseguir mejores oportunidades en el campo laboral, que me permitan llevar el sustento a mi casa y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de mis padres” con estas palabras Carlos manifiesta su motivación para solicitar el crédito el cual invertirá en el pago de un programa de capacitación en Cocina Fusión.
Su principal meta inicialmente es tener la oportunidad de empleo en un restaurante reconocido de la ciudad, donde pueda adquirir experiencia y, a mediano plazo poder iniciar su propio restaurante, con el fin de generar oportunidades de trabajo para otras personas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 24-year-old single man; he has no children yet.  He currently works as a cook in a restaurant and earns income this way to help support his home.  

“I want to train to improve my professional skills so that I can get better employment opportunities that will make it possible for me to support my home and cover my parents’ basic needs.”  With these words Carlos states his motivation for requesting the loan that he’ll use to pay for a Fusion Cuisine program training course.

His main goal initially is to be able to have the opportunity of getting a job in a well-known restaurant in the city where he can acquire experience and in the medium-term be able to open his own restaurant with the goal in mind of generating employment for others and improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking course.

loans.name: Som-Fiida Group

texts.fr:
Mme POKO KADIDIA est responsable du groupe SOM-FIIDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 38ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 04 vont à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.
Mme vend des condiments  depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Kombissiri et à Ipelcé. Ses clients sont les revendeurs.
Elle veut s’acheter 05 sacs de courgette, 02 sacs d’aubergines et d’autres condiments.
Mme utilise ses bénéfices afin d’acheter les condiments secs pour stocker et revendre au moment opportun. Elle ambitionne agrandir son commerce et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Poko Kadidia is the representative of the SOM-FIIDA group.  She is married and the mother of seven children.  Her oldest child is 38 years old and the youngest is 13.  Four of her children are in school, and she supports an additional person.

Poko Kadidia has been selling condiments for six years.  She stocks up in Kombissiri and Ipelcé and sells to resellers.

She wants to buy five bags of zucchini, two bags of eggplants and some other condiments.

She uses her profits to buy dry condiments to be stored and resold at the appropriate time.  Her ambition is to increase her business and to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy five bags of zucchini, two bags of eggplants and other condiments.

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Naumi is 47 years old and married with 2 children.  She has a retail shop in Kangundo town which she has been operating for the last 3 years.  She currently makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya Shillings.

This is Naumi's first loan term with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the amount to buy more items for sale, such as sugar, flour, rice, and cooking oil.  She anticipates making more income which she will use to buy more retail goods and a cow.  In the near future, Naumi hopes to expand her retail business and open a wholesale business, hence becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy retail items such as sugar, flour, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado El manantial son mujeres de Ciudad del Este están en su ciclo número 13 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo que gracias a su trabajo están superando su pobreza, y para conocer su situación están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Daniela es un ejemplo a seguir, ella es la presidenta, y también tiene su actividad independiente, que es la venta de prendas de segunda mano. Comenta que en sus ventas le va muy bien ya que las prendas de segunda mano están siendo muy solicitadas y tiene muy buena venta.
Daniela por medio de este trabajo está ayudando a su familia y les da para lo que necesitan en el día a día. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de segunda mano, para que con ello pueda seguir trabajando y ganándose el sustento.
texts.en:
The group called “El Manantial” (The Spring) is women from Ciudad del Este that are in their 13th cycle in the women’s committee program.  It’s a group that thanks to its work is overcoming their poverty and that in order to know each of their situations are completing the poverty elimination survey.

Daniela is an example to follow.  She’s the president and also has her independent activity which is selling second-hand clothes.  She comments that she does very well with her sales because second-hand clothes are in high demand and her sales are very good.

Daniela is helping her family by this means and is able to give them what they need day to day.  Today, she’s requesting this loan to buy second-hand clothes so that she can continue working and earning a living.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yeti Allah Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est responsable du groupe YETI  ALLAH. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.
Mme vend divers marchandises (de la patte d’arachide, des mangues, du tabac etc.)  depuis 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de paglayiiri et  à domicile. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter  un ½ sac d’arachide pour la préparation de la patte d’arachide.
Mme veut s’occuper de ses besoins avec  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne pouvoir stocker les arachides et faire toujours sa patte d’arachide afin de mieux s’occuper de sa fille.
texts.en:
Aminata is the representative of the YETI ALLAH group.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest child is 40 years old and her youngest is 20.  None of her children are in school.  Aminata also supports an additional person.

Aminata has been selling various goods such as groundnut paste, mangoes and tobacco for thirty years.  She stocks up at the Paglayiiri market and locally, and sells to both men and women.

She wants to buy half a bag of groundnuts to prepare groundnut paste.

Aminata wants to use her profits to take care of her own needs.  Her goal is to be able to store groundnuts and to continue to make groundnut paste in order to better provide for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy half a bag of groundnuts to prepare groundnut paste.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Campo Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Mujeres del Campo Verde” está en su Primer Ciclo del programa de comité, ellas están empezando a trabajar juntas y tienen toda la intención de ir creciendo y mejorando. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero trabajando por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Yrma quien a través de su esfuerzo y trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que le sale muy rica. Es una mujer emprendedora, y que pone todo de si, y que ve una gran esperanza en el programa de comité.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  más ingredientes para poder hacer sus alimentos, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, etc. lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres del Campo Verde” (Women of the Green Field) group is in its first cycle in the committee program. They are starting to work together and are determined to grow and improve.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and three of the women are below the poverty line, that is to say, with very low income but working to improve their lives.

One of the members is Yrma who by means of her effort and non-stop work and by applying the vital behaviors of successful women is improving her poverty situation.  She works selling food she prepares herself and that is quite delicious.  She’s an enterprising woman who puts everything of herself into it because she sees a great hope in the committee program.

She requests this loan to buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, condiments, etc. to make the food.  This will help her make her business plan reality and will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Mr. Abbas is a 35-year-old man. He lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Since 2005, Abbas has been running his own garment shop near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. 

He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his shop, including children's and men's shirts and socks. But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will not only help him to grow his business, but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase children's and men's shirts and socks to sell.

loans.name: Phillipina

texts.en:
Phillipina is 45 years old and married with 4 children.  She runs a hardware business in Kitengela town where she sells construction materials, such as cement, timber, paint, pipes, and water tanks.  She has been in this business for 8 years and it has been profitable.

This is her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more cement and nails to sell to the various construction sites.  She will use the generated income to pay college fees for her daughter.  She hopes to expand her business and open more hardware businesses in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more cement and nails to sell.

loans.name: Virgencita De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgencita de Caacupe está ubicado en Remansito, Chaco, se encuentran en su ciclo número (4to) del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Las 17 mujeres están trabajando en el programa de eliminación de pobreza, y están haciendo también la encuesta para ir mejorando sus vidas.
Magdalena es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras que hace está ayudando a su familia, obtiene los ingresos para ayudarles y salir adelante. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que quiere ir mejorando su vida, y espera que por medio de las capacitaciones también pueda crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar más productos frescos para la venta, como ser bananas, naranjas, manzanas, melones y demás frutas de estación para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes productos frescos.
texts.en:
The group called Virgencita de Caacupe is located in Remansito, Chaco. It is in its 4th cycle of the program of committee of women and everyone is working and helping to get ahead.  The 17 women are working in the Poverty Stoplight program and are using the survey to improve their lives.

Magdalena is one of the members of this group, who through the sale of fruits and vegetables is helping her family, obtaining income to help them and support them. She is a hardworking woman, who wants to improve her life, and hopes that she can also grow through the training sessions.

She is applying for a loan so she can buy fresh produce to sell, such as bananas, oranges, apples, melons, and other seasonal fruit so she can continue offering her customers fresh produce.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, oranges, apples, melons, and other seasonal fruit

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob has a motorcycle transport business in Kangundo town and has been in this business for 2 years. He is 27 years old and married with 2 children.  He currently makes a monthly income of 9,000 Kenya Shillings.

This being his second loan term, he plans to add to his savings and buy another motorcycle.  He hopes to generate more income which will be used to provide for the needs of his family (land for farming, school fees for his children).

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
Eloisa es una gran costurera, esta creciendo gracias al trabajo que esta haciendo, ella es muy trabajadora y emprendedora, esta muy agradecida porque gracias al crédito anterior de Kiva ella pudo comprar insumos para su pequeño taller, y así cumplir con sus clientes y los pedidos que recibe.
Hoy solicita de nuevo otro crédito para poder invertirlo de nuevo en la compra de telas e hilos, y de esa forma seguir invirtiendo en su emprendimiento, el cual es el sostén de su familia. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Eloisa is a great seamstress.  She’s growing thanks to the work she’s doing.  She’s very hardworking and enterprising.  She’s very grateful because thanks to her previous Kiva loan she was able to buy supplies for her small workshop thus satisfying customer requests and filling orders received.

Today, she’s requesting another loan to buy fabric and thread once again and thus continue investing in her enterprise which is her family’s source of support.  She is grateful for this new opportunity she’s getting which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Vya Renda Group

texts.es:
Las 14 mujeres de este grupo están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas. 3 de estas mujeres  se encuentran con ingresos muy bajos, es decir en el nivel rojo, pero ellas se están esforzando mas por ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blanca, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel rojo. Entre el trabajo que ella hace es la venta de  Golosinas, Empanadas también se debe destacar se que ella es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando por salir adelante e ir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Chocolates, Ingredientes para hacer sus alimentos  y otros ingredientes para poder ampliar más su cantina.
texts.en:
The 14 women in this group are taking the poverty elimination survey to get to know each of their situations.  Three of these women are very low income, that is to say level red, but they are striving to improve.

One of the members is Blanca who in the last survey was poverty level red.  Her work consists in selling snacks and turnovers and it should also be pointed out that she’s a very hardworking person who is striving to get ahead and to gradually improve her and her family’s quality of life.

She is asking for this loan to buy chocolates and ingredients to make her dishes as well as other ingredients to be able to expand her eatery more.

loans.use: to buy chocolates, food-preparation ingredients and other ingredients.

loans.name: Laureine

texts.en:
Laureine is a 24-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working in selling clothes from her house since four years ago to help her husband, who is employed with a very low income, in making their living and covering their family’s increasing expenses.

Laureine is a Palestinian refugee who puts so much effort on developing their living since they do not have variety of working majors to acquire.

Laureine is applying for a youth loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with a special summer clothes collection before the Holy Eid of Ramadan approaches (it is when people celebrate the end of Holy Ramadan month).

She hopes that one day she will be capable of opening her own clothes selling shop outside her house, which will increase her customers and will develop her family’s socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special summer clothes collection.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela nació en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta ciudad, ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta magnífica  relación tiene cinco hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella alterna las actividades del hogar con la venta de fruta y venta de comestibles entonces ella también tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos por lo tanto ella administra el negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar al puesto de venta, ella también tiene un estudio fotográfico  pero quien administra y atiende es otra persona. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fruta y material fotográfico. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Graciela was born in the beautiful city of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco and lives with her family in this city. She is 54 years old, married, and as a result of this wonderful relationship has five children she is bringing up.

She alternates her household activities by selling fruit and groceries and she also has a small stall at one of the markets in the city of Paucartambo where she sells her products and accordingly manages the business and assists her customers with a lot of kindness and courtesy and this is why they always return to shop at her sales stall.

She also has a photography studio but another person manages it and works there. She has been in this business for some years and is doing well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work. 

She belongs to the communal bank “Mamacha Carmen” and at this time she is requesting a loan in order to buy fruit and photographic material. She is grateful for the loan and agrees to responsibly comply with the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy fruit and photographic supplies

loans.name: Domiana

texts.en:
Domiana is 35 years old and married with 6 children.  She rears goats in Kangundo town and sells them to various butchery shops and markets.  She has been in this business for the past 5 years.  In addition, she also has a tailoring business.  

With this loan, her second with KADET LTD, she plans to buy more goat feed.  She also plans to buy more materials for making clothes.  She will use the anticipated income to educate her children by paying for their school fees.  In the near future, Domiana hopes to rear dairy cattle and supply milk in bulk.  This will fulfill her dream of becoming a successful livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy more goat feed.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is single and lives in Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. She owns a fishing boat and uses it for fishing. Mary Cris has been doing this business for years to earn a living.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit in an amount of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase new fishing nets. She plans to expand her business by having more fishing boats.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old and married with 3 children.  She rears cattle and poultry in Kangundo town.  She has been in this business for 10 years and it has been profitable.

This loan, her second with KADET LTD, will be used to buy feed for her cattle and poultry.  This will enable her to increase her milk and poultry sales.  She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.  Ester hopes to grow her business, make more income, and be able to install electricity in her homestead.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed.

loans.name: Lourdes Narcisa

texts.es: La cliente vive en el sector de Suburbio de Guayaquil.  Comenzó a trabajar hace 5 años vendiendo almuerzos y desde entonces no ha dejado de dedicarse a este negocio.  Labora sola en al mañana, de 9:00  11:30 am.  Tiene una relación de unión libre, en la cual su conviviente labora como taxi amigo.  Tiene hijos que ya son mayores de edad.  Necesita el crédito para invertir en materia prima para su negocio (comida y local).
texts.en: This client lives in Guayaquil’s Suburbio sector.  She started working five years ago selling lunch and since then hasn’t stopped working in this business.  She works alone mornings from 9-11:30.  She’s in a common law relationship and her spouse works as a taxi driver.  She has children who are all adults now.  She needs the loan to invest in raw materials for her business (food and locale).

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine operates a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a modern shop business in the near future. 

With the Kes. 50,000 she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and grains of rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and grains of rice for sale.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 44 years old and is married, with a son. Her husband is a teacher. 

Lan has been running a food stall for 17 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Lan is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more appliances and furniture for her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy furniture and appliances for her food stall.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru: Махина молодая незамужняя девушка, занимающаяся выпечкой. Ей 26 лет и живет она с родителями в городе Душанбе. Махина после окончания школы не смогла поступить в ВУЗ. Чтобы без дела не сидеть она научилась выпеканию булочек и печенье для продажи. Ей тогда было 19 лет. С тех пор и по настоящее время она занимается данным бизнесом. Она является мастером в своем деле. Махина при дворе своего дома имеет маленький цех, где она выпекает вкусные булочки, печенье и затем в горячем виде распределяет их по магазинам и супермаркетам. Ее товар быстро расходится и ее клиенты увеличиваются, что приносит ей хороший доход. Сейчас Махина хочет увеличить свое производство. Она просит кредит для закупа муки, маргарина, сахара, грецких орехов и яиц для выпечки большего количества булочек и печенье на продажу.
texts.en:
Mahina is a young, unmarried woman, engaged in baking. She is 26 years old and lives with her parents in the city of Dushanbe. After graduating from high school, Mahina was not able to go to college. In order not to sit around, she learned to bake muffins and cookies for sale. She was then 19 years old. From then until today, she has been in this business. She has become a master in this field. 

In her yard, Mahina has a small shop where she bakes delicious muffins and cookies, then serves them hot to other shops and supermarkets. Her goods are quickly spreading and her customers are increasing, which brings her a good income. 

Now Mahina wants to increase her production. She is requesting a loan to buy flour, margarine, sugar, walnuts, and eggs to bake a large quantity of cakes and cookies for sale.

loans.use: to purchase flour, margarine, sugar, walnuts, and eggs for baking cakes and cookies to sell

loans.name: Tsagaankhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsagaankhuu is 43 years old and lives with her daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling).  She has been making clothes on order for clients.  Before this job, she had been working as a sewer in the tailoring industry for eighteen years.  This year, her daughter will graduate from the university while her six-year-old son will attend elementary school. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,100,000 MNT in order to purchase a buttonholer and sewing machine.  These will replace the old ones for the purpose of increasing work efficiency.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a buttonholer and sewing machine.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles  au quartier SITOUGOULA de LOUTANA, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz avec MINATA debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 80.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi I group are married women who are, on average, 45 years old with six children each. They all live in traditional families in the Sitougoula neighborhood of Loutana, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Minata, a member of the group, is a rice farmer. In the photo, she is in the standing row, in the middle of the group. 

She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village and in Sikasso.

She is expecting to make a profit of 80,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her large family with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar nació en la ciudad de Sicuani pero vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 53 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella alterna las actividades del hogar con la venta de granos secos como por ejemplo habas, cebada, papa entonces ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos por lo tanto ella administra el negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a consumir. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar granos secos como por ejemplo maíz, habas, cebada, trigo,  y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Pilar was born in the city of Sicuani but lives with her family in the beautiful city of Paucartambo, Cusco Department.  She’s 53-years-old and in a common law relationship; she has three children she supports.  

She alternates her household activities with the sale of dry grains like lima beans, barley and potatoes.  She has a small stand in one of Paucartambo’s municipal markets where she sells her products.  She runs the business and tends to customers very kindly and courteously which is why they always return to buy.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

She belongs to the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy dry grains like corn, lima beans, barley, wheat and others.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy dry grains like corn, lima beans, barley, wheat and others.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: Margarito, tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien  tiene 3 hijos, y reside desde hace varios años en una aldea del municipio de protección, Santa Bárbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de maíz y frijoles, lleva 15 años de haber iniciado también con el cultivo de café, ya cuenta con dos manzanas de terreno cultivado. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 lempiras y los utilizara en la compra de insumos como fertilizantes y abonos para combatir la roya del café. Su plan es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo y tambien mejorar su condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Margarito is 47 years old and is in a common law marriage with his wife.  Together they have three children.  He has been living for many years in a small town in the Protección municipality of Santa Bárbara.  He has always made a living from corn and bean farming. 15 years ago, he also started growing coffee. He already has two blocks of farmed land.
The 10,000 lempiras loan he has asked for is to buy fertilizers and compost to fight against coffee rust. His plan is to improve the conditions of the harvest as well as improve the conditions of his life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost to fight against coffee rust

loans.name: Liaqat

texts.en:
Mr. Liaqat is a 40-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2005 Liaqat has been running a computer shop in the market, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.
